title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Tomorrow’s banking, brought to everyone.**
 Ready to combine deep engineering expertise with a product-first mindset to redefine the future of digital banking? As a
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 at Nordiska, you’ll help shape system architecture, deliver complex features, and write high-quality code - building embedded finance where banking meets tech.
   

  

**About Nordiska**
 Nordiska is a bank that provides innovative financial products for both companies and consumers. Nordiska Embedded is a platform for embedded financial services, where we offer savings, lending, and payment services, either under our own brand or through partners. Nordiska also provides corporate and real estate financing, as well as sustainable savings with a government-backed deposit guarantee.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Our code of conduct is the foundation for everything we do. We act with honesty and responsibility to build long-term trust among customers, partners, and employees. We believe that diversity drives innovation and encourages each employee to contribute their unique expertise and perspective. We are driven and dedicated to making a difference. Our employees receive a competitive benefits package.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Senior Software Engineer, you will primarily work with Nordiska Embedded. We combine the best of two worlds - at our core, we’re a stable, regulated bank paired with a product-tech mentality that thrives on agility, curiosity, and innovation. As Nordiska expands into new markets, onboards new customers, and builds new products and features, you work closely with the Tech Lead and Lead Engineer to set technical standards and ensure that the team’s output is robust, scalable, and secure. You’ll be an important part of modernizing systems, reducing technical debt, and contributing to system architecture, complex feature development, and code quality.
   

  

 In addition to your technical work, you’ll mentor engineering colleagues, foster a culture of continuous improvement, and contribute to a high-performing team as we grow.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
**As a Senior Software Engineer, some of your key responsibilities include:**
* Drive engineering excellence by defining technical standards, system architecture, design principles, and contributing to the long-term technology strategy.
* Deliver high-impact features - implementing complex functionality that meets stringent performance, reliability, and security requirements.
* Drive initiatives that improve performance, enhance scalability, and reduce technical debt.
* Anticipate and resolve architectural bottlenecks, proactively preventing issues.
* Ensure technical excellence through clean code, testing and observability, structured code reviews, and consistent application of best practices, fostering a culture of continuous learning.
* Cross-functional collaboration with Product and Engineering leadership to ensure technical execution supports strategic objectives.


**We’re Looking For Someone Who Has**
* Senior-level depth in programming, frameworks, and system design in C#/.NET.
* Expertise in event-driven architecture (EDA) and Azure; a strong interest in AI technologies is considered an advantage.
* Hands-on expertise with architectural patterns, scaling strategies, performance optimization, security, scalability and resilience.
* Demonstrated capability to mentor others and lead by example.
* Proven track record of delivering high-quality, large-scale software systems.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.


**Your Professional Profile**
* As a true self-leader, you take ownership and operate effectively in a fast-paced, high-accountability environment.
* You communicate clearly, collaborate seamlessly across functions, and navigate confidently in a regulated context.
* You’ll contribute to a high-performing and humble team, bringing strong analytical skills and a proactive, solution-driven approach.


**Application & Process**
 If you’re looking to join a growth-driven environment that pairs innovation with profitability and reliability, welcome to Nordiska. We look forward to receiving your application.
   

  

 We review and interview continuously, with background checks as part of the final stage of our process. For questions about the role and or more information, you are warmly welcome to contact Ida Garamvölgyi at ida.garamvolgyi@nordiska.com or +46704-385 325.
   

  

 Please note that we are also recruiting Software Engineers within our Scala stack follow the link!

title: Senior Frontend Developer (React/Next.js) - BESS Cloud Platform
description:
Seeking an Experienced Frontend Developer to shape the future of smart energy
   

  

 The European energy system is in the midst of a green transition, where battery energy storage systems will play a central role, and we need you to make it happen!
   

  

 Capture Energy, a fast-growing Swedish company founded in 2023 and with 38 employees currently, aims to become a market leader in the Nordics in providing battery energy storage systems (BESS) for energy flexibility services - a market that is expected to experience significant growth in the coming years. With innovation at our core, we're building the digital infrastructure that powers the clean energy transition - starting with our next-generation platform, Capture Cloud.
   

  

 As a small company today, we are able to operate very differently compared to the larger players on the market, which gives us a great competitive position. We are committed to bringing good energy to every setting where we operate: from our customers, partners, to our employees.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a
 **Senior Frontend Developer** 
 to join our team in Stockholm and help build the
 **user-facing applications** 
 of Capture Cloud. You will work with
 **Next.js (v14+, App Router) and TypeScript** 
 in an NX monorepo setup, building secure, scalable, and user-friendly web applications. You’ll collaborate closely with designers, backend developers, and the Tech Lead to deliver high-quality solutions that combine technical excellence with great user experience.
   

  

 This is an exciting role for a frontend engineer who wants to work with
 **modern frameworks, shared component libraries, and CI/CD pipelines** 
 , while contributing to the future of clean energy.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Design, develop, and maintain frontend applications using Next.js, TypeScript, HTML, and CSS.
* Implement and extend the backend-for-frontend (BFF) layer for authentication, API calls, and data transformations, hosting the applications in Azure using various Azure cloud services.
* Contribute to and maintain the shared component library (documented in Storybook) to ensure consistency and reusability across applications.
* Collaborate with backend developers, product managers, and designers to deliver secure, high-performing, and user-friendly applications.
* Translate Figma designs into high-quality, responsive UIs.
* Work with shared packages (utilities, API clients, modules) to avoid duplication and maintain a single source of truth.
* Participate in code reviews, mentor junior developers, and promote frontend best practices.
* Ensure applications meet high standards of performance, accessibility, and security.
* Contribute to CI/CD pipelines (build/test/lint, Docker images, deployment).


**Skills And Qualifications**
* 7+ years of professional frontend development experience.
* Strong expertise in React and Next.js (experience with Next.js v14+ App Router is a big plus).
* Proficiency in TypeScript and modern JavaScript (ES6+).
* Familiarity with backend-for-frontend (BFF) patterns, secure API calls, and data handling.
* Experience with Azure cloud services such as Functions, Container Apps, Key Vault, Application Insights, SignalR.
* Experience with shared component libraries, graph tooling such as Carbon Design, and tools like Storybook.
* Strong understanding of frontend architecture, design systems, reusable component patterns, and real-time communication (web sockets, server-sent events)
* Ability to translate Figma designs into production-ready UI with attention to detail.
* Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines, Docker, and frontend testing.
* Strong problem-solving skills, with a focus on performance and scalability.
* Familiarity with authentication/authorization flows in frontend apps (OAuth or OpenID Connect).
* Experience with accessibility standards (WCAG) is a plus.
* Experience with energy, IoT, or data-heavy platforms is a plus.
* Fluent in English.


 Why Join Us?
   

  

 As a part of our team, you will have the opportunity to work in an environment that encourages personal and professional growth. We are committed to supporting our employees, offering opportunities for training and progression to those who show dedication and enthusiasm in their roles. Our team is our most valuable asset, and we strive to ensure each member feels valued, supported, and inspired.
   

  

 We offer
   

  

* A chance to design and build the user-facing applications for Capture Cloud.
* Hands-on work with modern frontend technologies (Next.js, TypeScript, Storybook).
* An inspiring workplace where people are at the heart of everything we do, driving us toward our vision
* Competitive salary
* Maximized wellness contribution
* Pension and health insurance


 Application Process
   

  

 If you believe you have the responsibility, independence, and drive we are looking for, please submit your CV and a covering letter detailing your suitability for the role. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you and possibly welcoming you to our team.
   

  

**About The Company**
 Capture Energy, established in 2023, aims to be a major player in large-scale battery energy storage systems for flexibility services. We distinguish ourselves by providing turnkey solutions with smart services.
   

  

 Visit our website for more information: www.captureenergy.eu

title: Software Engineer
description:
**About Us:** 




  





**AmpsTek** 
 – a global technology leader since 2013 – is transforming how businesses approach technology and staffing solutions. Founded by seasoned technology leaders across the
 **UK, Europe, APAC, North America, and LATAM** 
 , and with registered offices in
 **30+ countries** 
 , we deliver exceptional service, scalable solutions, and measurable impact.
 



 With a
 **portfolio of 200+ clients** 
 and millions of users across web and mobile platforms, we empower businesses to innovate, grow, and succeed.
 







 Join our team and be part of a dynamic, growth-oriented organization that values talent, creativity, and results.
 



  





**Job Title:** 
 Software Engineer – Embedded Systems
 



**Location:** 
 Solna, Sweden
 



**Experience Range:** 
 4 to 12 Years
 



**Openings:** 
 2
 



**Work Authorization:** 
 Valid Sweden work permit is mandatory
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 The Software Engineer will be responsible for designing, implementing, and testing software components for a
 **Tachography system** 
 . The role involves working on safety-critical embedded software with a focus on CAN, Diagnostics, and Embedded C development.
 



  





**Mandatory Skills** 



* Hands-on experience with
 **FreeRTOS** 
 (or similar RTOS)
* Strong experience in
 **CAN and Diagnostic stack** 
 (preferably on FreeRTOS)
* Experience working with
 **sensor/actuator I/Os** 
 ,
 **UART, SPI** 
 , and other serial interfaces
* Strong proficiency in
 **Embedded C programming**



  





**Additional Preferred Skills** 



* MCAL layer Embedded C development
* In-depth understanding of
 **UART, serial communication, and IO code debugging**
* Strong understanding of
 **HW–SW interfaces** 
 , including electrical aspects and debugging
* Clear understanding of
 **code flow from FreeRTOS to lower layers**



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Translate software requirements into detailed design and implementation
* Develop and enhance features on a commonized code base
* Ensure compliance with
 **MISRA** 
 and safety-critical coding standards
* Perform static code analysis and resolve quality issues
* Develop unit tests and support
 **MC/DC coverage**
* Support integration and resolve defects during testing
* Maintain documentation and requirement traceability
* Collaborate closely with architects, system engineers, and test teams



  





**Required Qualifications** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering
* 4+ years of experience in embedded or safety-critical software development
* Strong knowledge of RTOS, embedded systems, and safety standards
* Experience with static analysis tools, unit testing, and CI/CD pipelines
* Good communication and documentation skills



  





 If this opportunity interests you, please share your
 **updated CV** 
 ,
 **availability** 
 , and
 **confirmation of Sweden work permit** 
 .
 



  





 Looking forward to hearing from you.

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
*Natural Cycles° is a leading women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, used by millions globally. We are a fast growing startup, and we promote an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues based in Stockholm, Geneva, New York, and remotely. Our mission is to pioneer women’s health through research and passion, empowering every woman with the knowledge she needs to take charge of her health.* 




  





 You’re a Frontend Developer who thrives in a fast-paced, data-driven, analytical and agile environment. Your soft skills shine and you can communicate with ease in English. You are passionate about technology, team work, but also have a responsibility and autonomy in your work. You are able to work efficiently in a remote work environment, in a setting where online and asynchronous communication is the foundation. You will be joining the Product team and working on app features designed to support and guide the user throughout her reproductive journey, through AI tools, feedback loops, and personalised in-app content. You will also be contributing to the Natural Cycles customer support chatbot.
 



  





**Please note that we are hiring for this role in Sweden.** 




  





**What you will be doing** 



* Ship top-quality, performant, accessible, inclusive user interfaces, features and products
* Work on the Natural Cycles core App, built as a Hybrid Web application, packaged for iOS and Android
* Work on the Natural Cycles customer support chatbot
* Work in an agile team together with other software engineers, product manager, designers & testers
* Work in close collaboration with stakeholders across the organization to deliver top-quality user interfaces and features
* Work hands-on with data insights and analytics and if possible, always take the data driven approach
* Ensure continuous delivery of new releases while working in an agile way
* Maintain a healthy codebase



  





**What skills and experience we think you have** 



* A minimum of one year of experience working in a professional software development team
* Experience in frontend development: building websites, web applications, responsive layout
* Good understanding of modern CSS
* Experience with TypeScript and Angular framework (or ability to quickly learn)
* Experience working with git, github, pull requests, code review etc.



  





**Not required but it would be a bonus if you also have:** 



* Experience with native iOS (Swift) and/or Android (Kotlin) development, or app development in general
* Experience with Node.js backend development
* A passion for women’s health



  





**Our technology stack includes:** 



* TypeScript, Node.js running on GCP Cloud Run
* Ionic, Angular, Capacitor, React
* 100% vite (no webpack since 2025)
* Firebase Hosting
* Highly automated CI pipelines in Github Actions
* AppStore/GooglePlay releases on a biweekly basis
* Friendly and thoroughly optimized development environment (“DX”)
* Claude Code



  





 We ♥ Open Source, encourage Open Source contributions and often open our general-purpose repositories. In 2025 our team members have contributed to: tsgo, react-router, @types/braintree, nodejs-datastore, pnpm, tensorflow, ngx-translate.
 



  





**What we offer** 



* Flexible work arrangement - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values effective collaboration and transparent communication, irrespective of work location
* Professional development - you will collaborate with industry leading developers, promoting continuous growth and skill enhancement
* Modern technology - you will leverage innovative technologies and tools, within an environment that empowers you to contribute ideas and take ownership of your work
* Impactful projects - you will contribute to groundbreaking projects that redefine industry standards and create tangible value
* Commitment to quality - you will join a dynamic and progressive organization that prioritizes profitable, long-term product development



  





**Location** 




 We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. Most of the Product development team you will work with is located in Stockholm.
 



  





**Sounds interesting?** 




 If you want to be part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position as soon as possible. We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





**How to apply** 




 To apply, just upload your CV and answer the questions on the application form. Keep in mind that we can't accept applications through email because of GDPR, and only applications submitted via the career site (and in English) will be considered.
 



 At Natural Cycles we value diversity and inclusion because we know that teams with people from different backgrounds and experiences are stronger. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
 



  





  





**Note: We are not looking for consultants or help from recruitment agencies**

title: F# utvecklare till Svea Bank
description:
Vi söker nu efter en nyfiken och lösningsfokuserad F# utvecklare som vill vara del av vår unika resa där vi bygger den bästa möjliga företagsbanken. Gillar du att arbeta med lösningar i fokus, driva kvalitativ utveckling och har ett stort intresse för funktionell programmering?
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Vi letar efter en erfaren F# utvecklare, men om du är en senior C# utvecklare eller utvecklare inom funktionell programmering med bredd, så tror vi att du också kan vara en match. Hos oss kommer du tillhöra en engagerad grupp av utvecklare som brinner för funktionell programmering och vi letar efter någon med samma mindset. Du kommer tillhöra ett utvecklingsteam med flera olika kompetenser såsom frontend, backend, test, design och produkt. Systemen vi bygger fokuserar mycket på att optimera automatiserade arbetsflöden, och våra användare är både interna och externa.
   

  

 Våra team ansvarar för att bygga och underhålla flera avancerade system inom Banking Services, vilka är byggda i F# på Microsoft SQL server. Vi arbetar med eventdrivna system på ett domändrivet sätt. Teamet har en hög autonomitet och en stor frihet kring hur de väljer att lösa problem. Teamet har även en hög grad av involvering från designfasen hela vägen till produktionssättning.
   

  

**Erfarenheter och kvalifikationer**
* 5 års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling
* Erfarenhet av arbete med F# (eller annat funktionellt språk såsom Haskell, Scala, ML, Elm eller Erlang) eller ett stort intresse av att utvecklas inom F# tillsammans med en stabil grund inom programmering
* Mycket god kunskap inom .Net, alternativt grundläggande kunskap om du är en erfaren utvecklare med annan bredd
* Relevant högskoleutbildning inom datateknik, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande, alternativt motsvarande kunskap genom arbetslivserfarenhet
* Mycket god kunskap om SQL
* Erfarenhet av eventdriven arkitektur
* Kunskper i Fable/Elmish eller React
* Svenska & engelska flytande i tal och skrift


**Vem är du?**
 Du har en gedigen bakgrund inom utveckling och förmågan att skapa enkel, tydlig och hållbar kod även i komplexa miljöer. Vidare är du en engagerad och coachande lagspelare som trivs med att vara en del av en helhet och motiveras av gemensamma framgångar. Du är kommunikativ och van att samarbeta med flera olika interna kontaktytor, samt tycker om att dela med dig av din kunskap och bidra till andras utveckling inom organisationen.
   

  

 Du har ett stort intresse för backendutveckling och funktionell programmering, men är också nyfiken på affären och det faktiska värde och syfte som applikationerna skapar. Din vana att ta ansvar för att driva utveckling framåt och din goda genomförandeförmåga matchas med ett lösningsorienterat mindset. Du ser möjligheter snarare än hinder och har en god förmåga att självständigt planera och driva ditt arbete framåt – samtidigt som du uppskattar samarbete, dialog och kunskapsutbyte i teamet.
   

  

**Om Svea**
*Svea är en finansiell koncern med över 2000 anställda och verksamhet i flertalet europeiska länder. Med mer än 40 års erfarenhet är vi stolta över att erbjuda innovativa och hållbara finansiella lösningar till våra kunder. Svea präglas av en familjär företagskultur där varje medarbetare bidrar med sin unika kompetens och engagemang. Vår företagskultur betonar gemenskap, handlingskraft, och balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Välkommen att följa med oss på vår spännande resa!*
**Ansökan**
 Vi har tyvärr inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via mail. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och vi önskar att tillsätta tjänsten så snart som möjligt så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt!
   

  

 Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Rekryterare Sanna Löfgren på sanna.lofgren@svea.com

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Role: Software Engineer**
 Want to create the world’s best mobile games? Have you got the skills to make that happen? We’re looking for a Software Engineer to join the Gameplay team in Candy Crush Soda Saga, King’s second largest game played by millions of people worldwide. We’re an ambitious team growing a sweeter future for one of the biggest casual mobile IPs in the world, with the ambition to continue raising the bar for creativity, product, and technology.
   

  

****Your role within the Kingdom****
 As a Software Engineer you will work primarily in C++ with our internal game engine. You will collaborate across disciplines with designers, artists, QA, and more, taking full ownership of your work as you convert business and design ideas into quality code. As part of the Gameplay team, you will work on the very core of the game, directly impacting the main player experience.
   

  

****In this role, you will:****
* Document, implement, and maintain gameplay features and systems in C++ within the Soda gameplay team.
* Collaborate closely with both engineers and other disciplines like design, art, product, and QA.
* Break bigger goals down into tasks, estimate time needed, and implement high quality solutions.
* Communicate frequently with your team, proactively updating them on progress and risks while sharing ideas or other relevant information with them.
* Uphold a high standard of quality through architecture and code reviews, testing, and iterating. Taking an active role in reviewing your peers' code and seeking out feedback on your own work.
* Improve game stability by investigating live issues, profiling, fixing bugs and working on tech debt.


****Skills to create thrills** 
 :**
* Comfortable communicating and working closely within cross-discipline teams.
* Strong knowledge in modern C++ and software design patterns.
* General engineering practices: Testing and reviewing code, architecting and explaining your design, working with version control, and documenting your work.
* Willingness to learn and improve continuously.
* Good at giving and receiving feedback.


****Bonus Points****
* Ability to work with high autonomy while keeping stakeholders informed.
* Experience debugging, profiling, and working within a large codebase.
* Comfortable guiding and mentoring junior engineers.


 You do not need to check every box to apply, but strong technical skill and a collaborative mindset are both key. If you’re excited about this role and think your experience aligns, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

******About King******
 King is a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, with a mission to make the world playful. From iconic franchises like Candy Crush to exciting new titles under King New Games, we bring delight to millions of players every single day. We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive environment. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.
   

  

****About King****
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Unity Developer
description:
**Requirements:** 



* Experience in designing modular gameplay systems that are easy to extend and maintain over time.
* Solid experience with C# and Unity, capable of writing clean, high-quality code.
* Experience building editors and tools in Unity
* A strong sense of technical ownership, able to take a feature from concept and exploration to a polished implementation.
* Not afraid of facing (and embracing) the unknown and working with exploratory tasks.

title: .Net developer with an interest for test automation
description:
SEB is more than just a bank with a technology function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From COBOL to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? As a .NET Developer within Payments & Reporting, you will play a key role in SEB’s digital transformation journey, helping to shape the future of the bank.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a .NET Developer you will be part of an agile international team of highly motivated and creative colleagues that work in close collaboration with our product owners and business specialists. Cross collaboration and interaction with other teams within Technology with focus on our delivery is also part of the work. The team’s main responsibility is to develop and maintain systems for the Payments domain.
   

  

 You will work with microservices architecture with responsive design for new development. The role also includes develop automatic tests and some manual testing. Our stack includes C#, .NET, MSSQL, Angular and JavaScript/TypeScript. Since our applications run 24/7, on-call is part of the job.
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we believe you have**
* 2-5 years of C# experience
* Frontend skills in Angular/React
* Experience with microservices and SPAs
* API/integration testing with tools like ReadyAPI, Protractor, Selenium
* Strong interest in development and test automation
* Responsible, collaborative, and comfortable with agile teamwork
* Service‑minded with high quality standards
* Positive, helpful, and solution‑oriented


**What We Offer**
* Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment: work-life balance, international working environment, hybrid work model, empowering and welcoming culture.
* Growth culture: extensive training and learning opportunities, local and international internal mobility possibilities, long-term stability.
* Modern environment: innovative company in forefront of technology, challenging, cutting-edge work, excellent office environment, agile and modern ways of working.
* Additional monetary benefits: paid seniority vacation and volunteering days, allocations to Your pension fund, profit sharing program, and additional health insurance.


 Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
   

  

 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 5th of February 2026. If you have questions about the position, please contact Johan Gasslander, johan.gasslander@seb.se.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Quantexa Developer
description:
Join Sii Sweden as a Quantexa Developer and contribute to the development of advanced data-driven solutions supporting financial crime prevention and transaction monitoring. You will design and maintain Quantexa and Spark-based applications that identify suspicious activities and potential money laundering patterns within large-scale financial data environments.
 



 This is a hands-on role combining data engineering, Quantexa development, and system stability responsibilities, offering the opportunity to work on critical systems that enhance transparency and trust in financial operations.
 



  





 Sii ensures that all employment-related decisions are made solely on the basis of qualifications and competencies. We are committed to equal treatment of all individuals, regardless of any protected characteristics, and promoting a diverse and inclusive work environment.
 



  





**Your tasks** 



* Drive release management and deployment activities
* Design, build, and maintain Quantexa and data applications using the Spark Framework
* Contribute to agile development processes and continuous improvement
* Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to deliver stable and scalable solutions
* Provide production support, managing escalations and ensuring system stability



  





**Requirements** 



* Quantexa Certification
* Proven experience implementing Quantexa cross-border transaction monitoring use cases for AML/financial crime prevention
* Strong programming skills in Scala
* Solid experience with Apache Spark and Hadoop ecosystem, as well as Unix shell scripting, SQL, and version control tools (GIT)
* Good understanding of ETL processes and data warehousing concepts

title: Embedded Hardware Developer
description:
Are you passionate about designing reliable, secure, and future-ready embedded electronics that power innovative products? ASSA ABLOY is looking for an experienced and forward-thinking Embedded Hardware Developer to play a key role in developing the next generation of our electronic solutions. Based in Stockholm, Sweden you will help build robust, scalable, and high-quality hardware that enables secure and seamless product performance trusted by customers worldwide. In this role, you'll thrive in a collaborative, innovative culture that empowers you to build a career to be proud of.
   

  

**What You Will Do As Our Embedded Hardware Developer**
 As our Embedded Hardware Developer, you will design, develop, and validate hardware solutions that meet demanding requirements for performance, security, and reliability. You will take responsibility from concept and schematic design through PCB layout review, prototyping, testing, documentation, and final validation for production readiness, while working closely with firmware and cross-functional engineering teams.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Design and develop embedded electronics and PCB solutions, including schematic capture and layout reviews
* Select and integrate suitable microcontrollers, sensors, components, and communication interfaces (SPI, I²C, UART, CAN, etc.)
* Conduct testing, debugging, optimization, and validation to ensure quality, reliability, and production readiness
* Ensure compliance with industry standards, including EMC/EMI considerations and best-practice design principles
* Collaborate closely with firmware and interdisciplinary teams while documenting designs and contributing to continuous improvement


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* 3+ years of experience working with embedded hardware development and PCB design.
* Hands-on experience with atleast one modern PCB design tool (Altium, KiCad, or similar).
* Good knowledge of microcontrollers and embedded systems, plus experience with some relevant communication protocols (for example SPI, I²C, UART, or CAN).
* Experience with hardware testing, debugging, and validation — ideally including EMC/EMI awareness.
* Fluency in English (both spoken and written).


 The ideal candidate is a collaborative and open-minded engineer who enjoys working closely with others to solve complex challenges. You are structured, analytical, and take pride in delivering reliable, high-quality results. With strong problem-solving skills and a keen attention to detail, you approach tasks with curiosity, ownership, and a practical mindset, ensuring designs are both technically sound and fit for real-world production.
   

  

**We review applications regularly, so don't wait.**
 We are building diverse and inclusive teams and encourage applications from all who can envision themselves working with us.
   

  

 To ensure that your personal information is secure, we do not review any applications sent via email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, please send an email to Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at Khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com .
   

  

 Let's together create a safer and more open world!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com.
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: IFS Cloud Developer
description:
As of 2 September 2025, Vivicta, former Tietoevry Tech Services, now operates as a standalone company under our new brand. We’ve officially launched Vivicta, your trusted Nordic transformation partner, making everyday easier through technology. You can explore more about our brand and what we stand for at https://www.vivicta.com
   

  

 Ready to join us? Click ‘Apply’ and complete our short application form to get started. Prefer another option? Apply via LinkedIn to automatically populate your details using your profile.
   

  

 Shape the Future of Business Solutions with us!
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced IFS Cloud Developer located in Sweden who wants to take the next step in their career and join a team where expertise, collaboration, and growth are at the core.
   

  

 At Vivicta, you will work in a dedicated IFS team while being part of a larger network of over 1,100 ERP consultants, sharing knowledge and learning from each other. As a leading system integrator and IFS partner, Vivicta offers you access to over 7000 colleagues with expertise in areas such as AI, security, infrastructure, testing, integration, and automation, giving you the opportunity to expand your skills and grow in multiple directions.
   

  

 We provide a culture built on collaboration, continuous learning, and openness, along with a flexible hybrid work model and a strong focus on work-life balance.
   

  

**When Joining Vivicta As An IFS Cloud Developer**
 You will play a key role in helping our customers develop and optimize their IFS Cloud solutions. Your work will involve both technical development and understanding business processes to deliver solutions that create real business value.
   

  

**Responsibilities Will Include**
* Implementing and upgrading IFS Cloud solutions.
* Translating business requirements into efficient processes and configurations.
* Developing customizations, scripts, and integrations based on customer needs.
* Ensuring high-quality delivery through testing and documentation.
* Sharing knowledge and providing guidance to colleagues and customers.


**We Believe You Have**
* Hands-on experience with IFS Applications 10 and/or IFS Cloud.
* Strong knowledge of SQL and PL/SQL.
* Familiarity with Git and REST APIs.


**Nice-to-have Skills**
* Experience with Azure DevOps, GitHub, or similar tools.
* Knowledge of C#, OData, or Cloud Build Place.
* Understanding of modern integration patterns and cloud technologies


**As a Person, We Believe You Are**
* Customer-focused with a strong ability to understand business needs.
* Adaptable and eager to learn new technologies.
* A natural collaborator who enjoys sharing knowledge and building long-term relationships.


**We Offer You**
* Exciting projects with both large and mid-sized customers across industries.
* Continuous professional development and opportunities to grow in your role.
* A supportive, low-hierarchy team where we learn from each other and have fun together.


 Location: Sweden (Hybrid)
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?** 
  

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Adam Taurell, adam.taurell@vivicta.com.
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*
*Vivicta declines calls from recruitment companies.*

title: iOS Developer
description:
*MAJORITY is a groundbreaking all-in-one digital financial service app that includes an FDIC-insured account, Visa® Prepaid card, money remittance, and international calling. We are built for migrants, by migrants.* 




*Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are following their dreams, love or new experiences, more and more of us are leaning towards new environments. Our purpose at MAJORITY is to empower the amazing, the brave, and the talented and help them achieve all of their ambitions.* 




*We believe that everyone deserves the same opportunity to succeed. Our mission is to provide migrants the tools to thrive in their new country.* 




*We are a diverse group of people from over 40 different countries that come together every day* 
*and we’re looking for others driven by the same desire to create meaningful products that bridge cultural and geographic distances.* 




  





 MAJORITY is looking for a skilled iOS Developer to join its Mobile team. This is a full time, in-person position based in Stockholm, Sweden. Developers may work from home up to 2 days a week.
 



  





**About our mobile apps and MAJORITY** 



* The two apps that we work on are written entirely in Swift. We also started adopting a bit of SwiftUI and the journey will continue
* The development team is up to date with iOS development best practices and software patterns
* To secure high quality code we practice code review and pair programming, we use CI/CD and automated testing
* We always strive to learn new things, so there’s room and space for that
* We have great cross team collaboration throughout the entire organization
* We also have a lot of fun together. We have a lunch run club, play foosball and other games, go the gym, AWs etc



  





**About you and your responsibilities** 



* You are ambitious and believe there’s always a solution, no matter the complexity of the task ahead of you
* You take pride in the quality of your work. You consider the whole system, cover the edge cases and test your code
* You use AI on a daily basis and strive to find new ways on how it can assist you and your team
* You wake up in the morning with positive energy to bring to work where you will collaborate with your colleagues and contribute to the organizational success
* You are able to reason through the trade-offs and dare to make decisions for the benefit of the organization
* You have a keen interest in architecture and know how to build complex applications that are maintainable
* You love to share the knowledge you have and to learn new things from your colleagues and other sources
* You are interested in learning new technologies



  





**Basic Requirements** 



* Good experience in Swift and iOS app development
* Knowledgeable about iOS, Apple, mobile, devices and related spheres of technology
* Excellent communication skills in English



  





**Ideal candidate** 



* 7+ years full-time professional iOS development experience
* Committed to writing excellent code
* Experience working with a growing team on evolving products with many users
* Experience building new products with an eye on maintainability and scalability
* Experience with payment platforms, FinTech, Banking or app security
* Happy hacking on new technology, loves R&D
* Always curious, always learning
* Vision for product development and for how a code base evolves
* A degree in computer science
* A pleasure to work with



  





**If you’re interested in joining our mission as an iOS developer, please apply by submitting your CV.** 




  





*We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*

title: Founding Customer Lead
description:
At Emfas, we are building the future of AI-driven product catalog management. We aim to do this by gathering a small team of exceptional individuals who are all obsessed over building an amazing product. We are now looking for a Founding Customer Lead to play a key role in scaling this team.
 



 We are reaching a critical inflection point for a product-led SaaS that’s scaling faster than headcount. We’re not looking for a traditional CSM, AE, or Support hire.
 



 You'll be the first dedicated hire focused on customer onboarding, activation, and growth. This is a founding role: you'll shape how we bring customers to value, inform how we sell, and ultimately build the systems that make much of this work automatic.
 



  




**What You'll Own** 


 Onboarding new customers
 



* Run onboarding sessions with new customers
* Understand their e-commerce setup and internal processes, and map to our product
* Educate customers on configuration and best practices
* Identify blockers and escalate to engineering when needed




 Activating existing customers on new features
 



* Stay close to, and influence, the product roadmap and understand what's shipping
* Use customer data to identify who would benefit from new features
* Proactively reach out to drive adoption
* Create lightweight enablement materials (short videos, guides) as needed




 Supporting sales
 



* Join sales conversations where product depth or technical context is needed
* Help prospective customers understand how the product fits their setup
* Inform how we position and sell based on what you learn in onboarding




 Feeding insights to product
 



* Capture patterns from customer conversations
* Synthesize and share insights with the product team weekly
* Flag urgent issues or opportunities as they arise




 Building for scale
 



* Identify what's manual today that should be automated or productized
* Partner with engineering to build self-serve onboarding flows, in-app guidance, and automated activation


**You Might Be a Fit If You** 
* Have worked in onboarding, growth, customer success, solutions consulting, or product at a SaaS company
* Are comfortable with technical products - you can understand integrations, data flows, and configurations without writing code
* Think in systems - you're not just doing the work, you're figuring out how to automate it
* Communicate clearly and can teach complex concepts simply
* Highly structured as a person, not leaving any loose ends
* Are proactive - you reach out to customers, not just respond to them
* Have e-commerce experience or genuine interest in the space
* Thrive in ambiguity and want to shape a function from scratch


**This Role Is Not** 
* A support role (you're not answering tickets)
* A pure sales role (you're not doing outbound prospecting or carrying a quota)
* A developer (you'll partner with engineering, not write code yourself)


**What Success Looks Like** 
* Time to value for new customers decreases
* Feature adoption rates increase after launches
* Product team has a consistent stream of actionable customer insights
* Sales wins deals faster with your involvement
* Make customers happy
* Product becomes increasingly self-serve over time


**Other** 
* Location: In-person at our office in central Stockholm
* Compensation: We provide a competitive salary + significant stock options program

title: Progress 4 GL utvecklare
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vi söker erfarna Progress-utvecklare till Financial Services i Stockholm. Hos oss på CGI får du arbeta med spännande uppdrag inom försäkring och finans, där teknik, affärsnytta och personlig utveckling går hand i hand.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som Progress Developer blir du en viktig del av vårt team och får arbeta med hela utvecklingsprocessen – från krav och design till utveckling, test och förvaltning. Du kommer både att vidareutveckla befintliga lösningar och bidra till nyutveckling, framför allt inom vårt försäkringsverktyg WinSure.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Gedigen erfarenhet av Progress OpenEdge 4GLoch Progress RDBMS
* Goda kunskaper i GIT
* Erfarenhet av Azure DevOps
* Erfarenhet av försäkringssystem, gärna WinSure
* Minst 10 års erfarenhet som systemutvecklare inom finans/insurance är meriterande


 Som person är du nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och trivs i konsultrollen. Du är trygg i din kompetens men vill ständigt utvecklas – både själv och tillsammans med kollegor och kunder.
   

  

**Varför CGI?**
 Vi erbjuder en kultur som bygger på samarbete, kunskapsdelning och balans i livet. Hos oss får du:
   

  

* Arbeta i inspirerande uppdrag tillsammans med kunniga kollegor
* Tillgång till program för karriär- och kompetensutveckling
* Möjlighet att påverka och växa i en stark global organisation


 Det finns möjlighet till hybridarbete, vilket innebär en flexibel kombination av arbete på kontoret och på distans. Det är en fördel om du är baserad i Stockholm, men vi välkomnar även ansökningar från andra delar av landet!
   

  

 Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens lösningar inom försäkring? Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att höra av dig till rekryterande chef Susann Edvardsson Alpsten på susann.edvardsson@cgi.com
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Software Validation Engineer
description:
**SOFTWARE VALIDATION ENGINEER**
 Are you looking for a role where your technical expertise directly improves the lives of people?
   

  

 At
 **Permobil** 
 , we are world leaders in advanced mobility solutions. We are now looking for a
 **Software Validation Engineer** 
 to join us and ensure that our software meets the highest standards of safety, quality, and reliability.
   

  

**Join us and shape the Future of Mobility Solutions!**
**Location** 
 : Solna, Sweden
   

  

**Position Overview**
 As a Software Validation Engineer at Permobil, you will be part of a team dedicated to excellence. Our products are life-enhancing tools, not just gadgets. Although we do not produce implants or pharmaceuticals, our products are classified as medical devices. This means your work is vital in ensuring we comply with international regulatory standards, providing our users with safe and dependable technology.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Validation & Compliance: Design, implement, and document validation tests in accordance with FDA 21 CFR Part 11 and EU (MDR) regulations for medical devices,
* Quality Assurance: Ensure that all software components meet functional and safety requirements through rigorous verification and validation (V&V) processes,
* Collaboration: Work closely with R&D, Quality, and Regulatory teams to ensure a smooth path from development to market,
* Risk Management: Participate in risk analysis and mitigation strategies to ensure the highest level of patient/user safety,
* Test Automation: Maintain and further develop our testing environments, balancing manual precision with automated efficiency.


**Skills & Qualifications**
* Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field,
* Experience working with software validation, preferably within Medical Technology (ISO 13485, IEC 62304) or other highly regulated sectors (e.g., Automotive or Aerospace),
* Experience with Python, C++, or similar languages for test automation,
* Disciplined, yet pragmatic approach to documentation and testing, you understand that in our industry, "good enough" is never enough,
* Fluency in written and spoken English (Swedish is a strong merit),
* You enjoy working in a cross-functional environment.


**Why is Permobil the next step for you?**
* You’ll make a difference. Every day. Everything we do leads to understanding and improving the lives of our users. Through our evidence-based innovation, we make a difference to people’s lives.
* You’ll make your mark as part of our future. We collaborate with colleagues across borders to Innovate for Individuals. The impact you make personally could lead change around the world.
* You’ll feel welcome from day one. We’re known for being great colleagues, who are collaborative, fun and at the cutting-edge. Everyone at Permobil cares as much as you do about making a positive difference.


**Application Process**
 We will conduct selection continuously so send us your application today or before
 **February 28th** 
 at the latest!
   

  

 Permobil is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals.
   

  

 For more information about the position, please contact Fredrik Håkansson, Manager of Application & Infrastructure, fredrik.hakansson@permobil.com
   

  

 For information about the recruitment process, please contact Zivile Mitkute, Talent Acquisition Partner, zivile.mitkute@permobil.com
   

  

**Please respect that we do not wish recruitment assistance or advertising, we decline calls from recruitment and advertising providers.**
**More About Permobil**
 Permobil founder Dr. Per Uddén believed that helping people achieve the greatest level of independence is a basic human right and, for over 50 years, Permobil has held fast to that belief. Permobil is a global leader in advanced rehabilitation technology, passionate about better understanding our users’ needs and improving their quality of life through state-of-the-art healthcare solutions. Today, those solutions include power wheelchairs, seating and positioning products, power assist, and manual wheelchairs.
   

  

 Permobil is part of Patricia Industries, a subsidiary of Investor AB, and is headquartered in Sweden. Permobil has 2 000 team members in 18 countries around the world. For more information regarding the company’s storied history and complete product line, visit permobil.com.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Android
description:
**About the Company** 




  





 At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it. FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day. We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field. Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Designs solutions to meet the requirements (business and tech). Able to challenge and proactively suggest improvement to requirements.
* Contributes to best practice, pro-actively looks to improve status quo e.g. can the team improve logging, performance testing etc.
* Focused and engaged in team commitments, takes ownership to help the team reach their goals.
* Constructively critique solutions and code of peers.
* Actively seeks to automate where relevant with a shift left mindset (catch bugs early during development).
* Follows and implements good practices in quality assurance (e.g. BDD, TDD).
* Confidently makes decisions affecting the team.



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* Can work independently and writes high quality code using appropriate techniques creating performant solutions.
* You have experience working with different systems and architectures which you can draw on to contribute to the solutions in your team.



  





**Required Skills** 




  




* Ability to code review, give and receive feedback.
* Ability to break down technical GAP documents/requirements into deliverable work items.
* Experienced with automating to improve efficiency and catch defects early.
* Good communication skills to work with team and stakeholders.
* Understanding and adoption of good practices such as TDD, BDD.
* Experienced in incident management.
* Experienced in writing, executing and analyzing performance tests.
* Ability to effectively represent the team in stakeholder discussions using domain concepts and language.
* Understanding of risk assessment and impact analysis.
* Good grasp of secure development.
* Experienced in working with agile practices and able to suggest improvements to the team's process.
* Maintain the team's CI/CD pipelines.
* Use appropriate code analysis tools to improve code quality and security.

title: Lead Solution Engineer - Mulesoft
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Sales
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 Salesforce is the #1 AI CRM, where humans with agents drive customer success together. Here, ambition meets action. Tech meets trust. And innovation isn’t a buzzword — it’s a way of life. The world of work as we know it is changing and we're looking for Trailblazers who are passionate about bettering business and the world through AI, driving innovation, and keeping Salesforce's core values at the heart of it all.
   

  

 Ready to level-up your career at the company leading workforce transformation in the agentic era? You’re in the right place! Agentforce is the future of AI, and you are the future of Salesforce.
   

  

 Salesforce is hiring for a Solutions Engineer within
 **MuleSoft** 
 to join our Pre-Sales Solution Engineering team, which plays a pivotal role in driving MuleSoft's growth. As a Pre-Sales Solution Engineer, you will serve as a technical sales partner to our sales teams, aligning our solutions with our customers' visions. The MuleSoft Sales team will lean on your technical and product expertise throughout the sales cycle to formulate the sales strategy. You will be a vital contributor to the success of both our customers and Account Executives by conducting technical discovery, qualification, reframing, challenging the status quo, delivering product demonstrations and Proof of Concepts, facilitating technical workshops, and offering architectural recommendations.
   

  

 In the role of a customer trusted advisor, you will bridge the gap between the technical solution and the desired business outcomes for the customer. You will take ownership of solution reliability and be the conduit for ensuring the customer's needs are met.
   

  

**What You Get Working For MuleSoft Solution Engineering Sweden**
* Working in a passionate Pre-Sales Solution Engineering team that puts teamwork first
* Leaders who really care about your development and success
* Working for a company that truly lives its core values Equality and Sustainability
* Working for one of the most innovative companies worldwide


**Qualifications You’ll Need To Be Successful**
* Excellent presentation and composure abilities in front of technical and non-technical key stakeholders
* Skills to establish trust with clients, and the ability to influence key decision makers
* Solid oral, written, presentation, collaboration and interpersonal communication skills
* Ability to work as part of a team to solve technical problems in alignment with the sales strategy
* Degree in IT / Business Informatics or equivalent relevant experience required
* Hands-on Java development experience and ability to code and debug against Java APIs is preferred
* Experience with cloud technologies - iPaaS, SaaS applications, Automation solutions, cloud infrastructure, IA is preferred
* Experience building and delivering Proofs of Concept (PoCs) and responding to functional & technical elements of RFIs/RFPs independently
* A passion for technology and an ability to translate that passion to impact business for our customers
* Ability to travel as needed
* Languages: English + Swedish are essential
* Minimum of 4 years of professional experience
* Experience will be evaluated based on alignment to the core competencies for the role (e.g. extracurricular leadership roles, military experience, volunteer work, etc.)


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Salesforce and/or MuleSoft Certifications
* Previous experience as a solution/sales engineer for a Software company in similar technologies (Integration, APIM, Automation, CRM, Analytics,...)


**3 Months**
**What you’ll achieve:**
* Learn MuleSoft Anypoint Platform and get certified in MuleSoft’s Developer Trainings
* Complete MuleSoft’s Kickstart sales training
* Begin to build your architecture reframe and whiteboarding skills through shadowing and customer-scenario role playing
* Create a Self Service Asset on a MuleSoft technical topic of interest


**12 Months**
* Become certified in all Product, Architecture, and Sales Messaging trainings
* Execute Architectural Workshops/Engagements, PoCs, and demos with our Partners
* Enabling partners on technical and architectural elements of the MuleSoft platform
* Mentoring, assisting, and enabling partners through Pre-Sales Engagements
* Guide our strategic Partner Technologists, Client Leads, Practice Leads, Vertical BU leads, CTOs, Engineers, and Consultants through MuleSoft Point of View
* Create and execute high impact Technical/Architectural presentations and top notch programs/workshops/demos, for Partner Technical and Architectural enablement
* Respond to functional and technical elements of RFIs/RFPs
* Partner with the Channel Teams and the sales reps in the partner on account planning and strategy and support marketing with evangelism activities (writing blogs, participating in demo-driven webinars, speaking at industry events, etc.)


**Benefits & Perks**
 Check out our benefits site which explains our various benefits, including well-being reimbursement, generous parental leave, adoption assistance, fertility benefits, and more
   

  

 Unleash Your Potential
   

  

 When you join Salesforce, you’ll be limitless in all areas of your life. Our benefits and resources support you to find balance and
 *be your best* 
 , and our AI agents accelerate your impact so you can
 *do your best* 
 . Together, we’ll bring the power of Agentforce to organizations of all sizes and deliver amazing experiences that customers love. Apply today to not only shape the future — but to redefine what’s possible — for yourself, for AI, and the world.
   

  

 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Java Utvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Teknisk högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom datateknik eller motsvarande.
* Goda kunskaper i Java, samt gärna i C/C++ eller Python.
* Flytande svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Förmåga att ta ansvar, fatta beslut och driva utveckling framåt.
* Trivs med både självständigt arbete och att samarbeta i team.
* Ett nyfiket och lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 29-01-2026
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Fullstack utvecklare med frontend fokus (React) till Svea Bank
description:
Har du arbetat flera år med fokus på frontend utveckling i React och vill bli del av ett tvärfunktionellt team som arbetar nära affären? Vill du bidra med dina kunskaper och erfarenheter i en snabbrörlig miljö där ni skapar en modern bank med framåtlutade tekniker?
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Detta är en fullstack roll där störst fokus ligger på frontend (React) och användarupplevelsen. Vi ser att du bidrar med en förståelse för och delar dina insikter kring frontend arkitektur, samtidigt som du har förmåga och kunskap att vid behov utföra en del backend utveckling i .NET / F#.
   

  

 Du blir del av ett av utvecklingsteamen i Sveas affärsområde Banking Services, som bygger den bästa möjliga företagsbanken. Teamet består av front- och backendutvecklare, QA, UX och Produktägare.
   

  

 Här arbetar du med både ny- och vidareutveckling samt förvaltning i React och .NET / F# tillsammans med kollegorna i teamet. Teamet arbetar enligt agil metodik och CI/CD pipelines, i en miljö där det är viktigt att förstå och ha ett intresse för affären och de produkter och tjänster vi arbetar med.
   

  

**Erfarenhet & kvalifikationer**
* Flera års erfarenhet av rollen som Frontend/Fullstack utvecklare, vilket innebär att du har förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i den här rollen, arbeta självständigt, samt kan stötta andra i teamet
* Mycket goda kunskaper i React
* Goda kunskaper i .Net / F#
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt, samt av TFS, Jira eller liknande
* Högskole-/Universitetsutbildning inom Systemutveckling eller liknande område, alternativt motsvarande kunskap genom arbetslivserfarenhet
* Mycket goda kunskaper i engelska i både tal och skrift
* Kunskaper i svenska är meriterande


**Vem är du?**
 Du har en gedigen bakgrund inom utveckling genom vilken du har med dig förmågan att skapa enkel och ren kod även i tidvis komplex miljö. Du är en engagerad och coachande lagspelare som trivs med att vara del av en helhet, och gläds åt gemensamma framgångar. Vidare är du kommunikativ då du dagligen har olika kontaktytor internt samt gillar att förmedla och föra din kunskap vidare till andra inom organisationen. Du har självklart ett stort intresse för frontend utveckling, men är också nyfiken på själva affären och syftet applikationerna vi utvecklar har. Du ser möjligheter och lösningar, och har god förmåga att själv planera och driva ditt arbete framåt – även om du också trivs i samarbete och vill bolla och dela kunskaper.
   

  

***Om Svea***
*Svea är en finansiell koncern med över 2000 anställda och verksamhet i flertalet europeiska länder. Med mer än 40 års erfarenhet är vi stolta över att erbjuda innovativa och hållbara finansiella lösningar till våra kunder. Svea präglas av en familjär företagskultur där varje medarbetare bidrar med sin unika kompetens och engagemang. Vår företagskultur betonar gemenskap, handlingskraft, och balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Välkommen att följa med oss på vår spännande resa!*
**Ansökan**
 Vi har tyvärr inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via mail. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och vi önskar att tillsätta tjänsten så snart som möjligt så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt!
   

  

 Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Rekryterare Sanna Löfgren på sanna.lofgren@svea.com

title: .Net utvecklare
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Minimum 8 years of experience in .NET development, with proficiency in web.
* Minimum 3 years of experience working with Azure App services, including deployment, configuration, and management.
* Strong knowledge of frontend frameworks such as Bootstrap UI and Vue.js.
* Familiarity with open-source dotnet products for CMS and ecommerce.
* Experience with Azure services such as Cosmos, Azure Serverless SQL Server, Azure DocumentDB, Azure Storage, Azure Service Bus, Azure AD, Azure Front Door, Azure API Management, Azure Traffic Manager, Elastic Search, Azure Functions, Azure Cognitive Services, Chat-GPT , and others.
* Proven ability to develop and deliver end-to-end solutions in an Agile development environment.
* Solid understanding of software development best practices, including code optimization, testing, and version control.
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently as well as in a collaborative team environment.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to effectively convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


**Meritorious**
* Prior experience in developing ecommerce platforms or related projects.
* Familiarity with headless architecture and composable services.
* Experience with Azure DevOps or similar CI/CD tools.
* Knowledge of Elastic Search or similar search technologies.


**Application deadline:** 
 28-01-2026
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Head of Frontend Development
description:
**Startdatum:** 
 ASAP
   

  

**Slutdatum:** 
 Option på förlängning
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 100 %
   

  

**Plats:** 
 Stockholm eller Malmö, hybrid
   

  

**Uppdragsbeskrivning**
 En internationell aktör genomför en strategisk satsning på en skalbar frontend-plattform. Uppdraget innebär ett helhetsansvar för arkitektur och teknisk riktning för användargränssnitt som används av flera produkter och marknader.
   

  

 Rollen har ett tydligt plattformsfokus där modularitet, prestanda och återanvändbarhet prioriteras. Frontendlösningarna utvecklas i nära samspel med backend och plattform, med kontraktsstyrd API-design och strikt typning som grund.
   

  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**
* Definiera och vidareutveckla frontendarkitektur med fokus på prestanda, återanvändbarhet och långsiktig hållbarhet
* Säkerställa tydliga API-kontrakt i samarbete med backend- och plattformsteam
* Delta i systemdesign och påverka datamodeller för att stödja komplexa UI-flöden
* Samverka kring molnbaserad driftsättning och leverans av frontendapplikationer
* Coacha och stötta utvecklare samt etablera gemensamma arbetssätt och standarder


**Skall-krav**
* Mångårig erfarenhet av frontendutveckling i moderna JavaScript-ramverk
* Djup kunskap inom Vue 3 och komponentbaserad arkitektur
* Stark kompetens inom TypeScript och strikt typning
* Erfarenhet av samarbete kring API-design och datakontrakt
* Vana av molnbaserade miljöer och frontenddrift
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av tekniskt ledarskap eller arkitektansvar


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet från datatunga eller realtidsnära system
* Bakgrund inom analys- eller dashboard-intensiva applikationer
* Kunskap om moderna testverktyg och byggkedjor
* Förståelse för distribuerade system och mikrotjänstarkitektur

title: Systemutvecklare .NET, Stockholm
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
*Vill du arbeta med teknik som gör verklig skillnad?*
 Hos oss blir du en del av agila team som utvecklar lösningar som effektiviserar vården, stärker samhällsfunktioner och förbättrar vardagen för tusentals människor. Som fullstack .NET-utvecklare arbetar du genom hela kedjan – från databaser och APIer till moderna webbgränssnitt. Du utvecklar .NET-baserad backend i C#, ASP.NET Core och REST-APIer och använder tekniker som Entity Framework Core och SQL Server. På frontendsidan arbetar du med TypeScript och moderna ramverk som React eller Angular.
   

  

 Hos oss blir du en viktig del av teamleveranser som präglas av kvalitet, kunskapsdelning och innovation. Du arbetar nära både kollegor och kund, ofta i långsiktiga uppdrag inom offentlig sektor, energi och telekom. Läs mer här.
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Har minst sex års erfarenhet av .NET och C#, inklusive arbete med ASP.NET Core, REST APIer och databaser
* Har arbetat fullstack med moderna webbramverk i JavaScript eller TypeScript, gärna React eller Angular
* Har erfarenhet av att bygga skalbara och robusta webbapplikationer från datalager via API till gränssnitt
* Trivs i eller är nyfiken på konsultrollen
* Talar och skriver svenska samt engelska obehindrat


**Det är ett plus om du också har erfarenhet av:**
* Azure
* Mikrotjänster
* DevOps-kunskaper, såsom CI/CD, Docker


**Att jobba på Sopra Steria**
 Hos oss får du det bästa av två världar – ett stabilt bolag med stora kunder och resurser, i kombination med entreprenörsanda och stark teamkänsla. Vi erbjuder utmanande och varierande uppdrag där du kan bidra tekniskt för att göra skillnad i samhället. Med kollektivavtal, marknadsmässiga löner, flexibilitet och en kultur präglad av kunskapsdelning och samarbete vill vi ge dig den bästa arbetsmiljön för att lyckas. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss här.
   

  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**
 Vi behandlar ansökningar och kallar till intervju löpande. I rollen ställs höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet. Inför en eventuell anställning genomför vi bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
   

  

 Processen består av tre intervjuer, personlighet och logiktest, referenstagning samt bakgrundskontroll. Kombinationen ger oss en rättvis och bred bild av dig, och ger dig möjlighet att visa din kompetens ur flera perspektiv.
   

  

 📩 Har du frågor om rollen Kontakta gärna Hanna Korell på hanna.korell@soprasteria.com.
   

  

 Välkommen till Sopra Steria i Stockholm, vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: .NET Utvecklare
description:
På Sigma Technology Digital Solutions söker vi erfarna systemutvecklare som vill vara med och ta idéer hela vägen till fungerande lösningar – och ha kul på vägen. Vi tror på att göra bra saker tillsammans, både för våra kunder, våra kollegor och framtiden vi är på väg mot.
 



  





 💡 Hos oss får du det bästa av två världar: tryggheten i ett stabilt bolag och friheten att forma din egen vardag. Du blir en del av ett lag där vi delar kunskap, testar idéer och gärna hjälper varandra när det behövs. Ny teknik, lärande och utveckling är inget sidospår hos oss – det är en naturlig del av jobbet.
 



  





 🌍 Vi jobbar med kunder inom många olika branscher, så oavsett om du gillar att grotta ner dig tekniskt, förstå affären bakom lösningen eller bara vill ha variation i vardagen, finns det gott om möjligheter.
