 Konsulten bör ha dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av att leda arbete i en miljö präglad av skalade agila ramverk (t.ex. SAFe) och leda projekt där utvecklingen sker i olika produkter/team som ej är dedikerade till projektet.
   

  

 Konsulten bör ha dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av att pedagogiskt visualisera och kommunicera strategiska och komplexa samband mellan ITsystem och verksamhetsförmågor för beslutsfattare och ledningsgrupper.
   

  

**Stationeringsort**
 Solna. Upp till 50% distansarbete tillåts.
   

  

**Start-slut + option**
 2026-02-23 - 2028-02-21 + option: 1 år.
   

  

**Omfattning**
 100%
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 2026-01-28
   

  

 Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV
 **(** 
 vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.

title: Modern Workplace Engineering Architect | M365
description:
**Summary**
 Unlock the potential of Modern Workplace Engineering Architecture as a visionary architect, transforming challenges into cutting-edge solutions and leading the transformation and the empowerment of business to thrive in the digital era with Microsoft technologies.
   

  

 Are you a visionary Microsoft 365 Architect? Join our Modern Workplace Practice and unleash your expertise in crafting innovative solutions that harness the full potential of Microsoft 365 suite. You will have a pivotal role in our team as Solution Architect where you will need to understand the business needs and requirements and turn it into innovative solutions based on Microsoft technologies. You will become the front figure in projects and mentor to your peers to drive transformative success with your unparalleled skillset.
 **Together we do what matters.**
**Key Responsibilities**
 As a Modern Workplace Engineering Architect, your focus is on Microsoft 365 suite solutions within the Workplace services field. You will apply your expertise in M365 solutioning by translating business requirements into innovative technical solutions. Acting as a front figure in projects, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams under challenging circumstances to deliver high-quality solutions, ensuring customer satisfaction and fostering client relationships. You will stay updated with the latest technological trends in the Modern Workplace domain and attend partner events, sharing best practices and mentoring professional coworkers in the Modern Workplace domain to deliver cutting-edge solutions.
   

  

 Some of the best things about working at Avanade
   

  

* Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 years in a row), with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
* Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth
* Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you


**Benefits**
 Find out more about some of our benefits here.
   

  

 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!
 **Together we do what matters.**
 We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our Inclusion & Diversity page.
   

  

 Create a future for our people that focuses on
   

  

* Expanding your thinking
* Experimenting courageously
* Learning and pivoting


 Inspire greatness in our people by
   

  

* Empowering every voice
* Encouraging boldness
* Celebrating progress


 Accelerate the impact of our people by
   

  

* Amazing the client
* Prioritizing what matters
* Acting as one


**Qualifications**
 You have previous and solid experience with:
   

  

* Demonstrating confidence in designing end-to-end solutions across Microsoft 365 suite.
* Showing good control and eager leadership in managing clients' conversations.
* Understanding business advantages in Microsoft security tools (i.e. Defender and Purview).
* Implementing Microsoft Identity and Endpoint Management techniques and best practices.
* Using with natural proficiency PowerShell.
* Applying strong business acumen in migrations tools (i.e. Quest), Code controls (i.e. Git repositories), ITSM tools, Azure and automation.
* Showing a critical thinking, problem-solving and troubleshooting approach.


 You’re a natural leader who fosters collaboration and manages dynamic teams to drive project success. You will proactively identify business opportunities to enhance and expand the range of Microsoft 365 suite business solutions provided to clients. Your interpersonal and communication skills help technical and non-technical clients engage with often complex information.
   

  

**Characteristics That Can Spell Success For This Role Are**
* Stay ahead of the curve and explore groundbreaking solutions with a genuine thirst for success.
* Be an adviser to emerging technologists on career growth opportunities.
* Act as a trusted mentor, providing performance reviews and feedback when necessary.
* Be a relationship builder, engaging with clients to ensure their satisfaction.

title: Business Development Agent (SE)
Utredningsanalytiker
description:
*Vill du vara med och forma framtidens bedrägeribekämpning inom försäkringsbranschen? Som utredningsanalytiker får du en central roll i att driva utvecklingen framåt och bidra till att vi når vårt mål; att bli Sveriges ledande bedrägeriförebyggande försäkringsbolag. Här får du arbeta i ett engagerat team där vi lär av varandra och där dina idéer och initiativ värderas högt.*
**Om jobbet**
 I rollen som utredningsanalytiker får du möjligheten att arbeta både strategiskt och operativt med att utveckla och stärka vårt förebyggande arbete mot bedrägerier. Du kommer att vara en viktig länk mellan utredare och våra IT/AI-specialister, och samarbeta med kollegor från hela länsförsäkringsgruppen. Arbetet är ofta team-baserat och du kommer att ha många kontaktytor både inom och utanför organisationen.
   

  

 Vi är ett självgående team med starka individer som svetsas samman av våra likheter och olikheter. Hos oss är det högt i tak, vi lär av varandra och sätter laget före jaget. Här får du ansvar och möjlighet att växa. Vi tror på att prova nytt, och att även misstag är en väg till utveckling. Du rapporterar till Chef utredning LFAB och har många kontaktytor inom hela länsförsäkringsgruppen, inklusive utredningsavdelningar och utvecklingsinsatser inom Länsförsäkringar.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Initiera och driva utvecklingsinsatser inom det förebyggande bedrägeriarbetet
* Analysera stora datamängder och rekommendera utrednings- samt förebyggande åtgärder
* Biträda i utredningar och bidra med research och analys
* Omvärldsbevaka och hålla dig uppdaterad kring nya trender och metoder inom området
* Delta i och leda bedrägeriförebyggande projekt inom LFAB och länsförsäkringsgruppen
* Fungera som länk mellan utredare och AI/IT-avdelningen


 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av liknande roll
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av research och analys av stora datamängder
* Erfarenhet av projektledning
* God förståelse för IT-utveckling
* Intresse för AI/machine learning
* Goda kommunikationsförmågor på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Tidigare dokumenterad erfarenhet från liknande arbetsuppgifter inom polis eller annan myndighet


 Som person är du nyfiken och orädd – du ser nya utmaningar som spännande möjligheter att utvecklas. Du är noggrann, lämnar inget åt slumpen och har förmågan att slutföra det du påbörjar. Du är ödmjuk, stresstålig och vågar säga vad du tycker samtidigt som du värdesätter andras åsikter. Du trivs i team, uppskattar olikheter och bidrar till att gruppen blir starkare tillsammans.
   

  

**Kontaktuppgifter:**
 Rekryterande chef: Magnus.Persson@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Forena: susanne.hirsch2@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen: maria.eriksson@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
 Länsförsäkringar AB är en inkluderande arbetsplats där mod, möjligheter och engagemang står i centrum. Vi erbjuder ett hållbart arbetsliv med flexibla villkor och satsar på att alla medarbetare ska kunna växa och trivas, oavsett bakgrund.
   

  

 Affärsenhet Sak är länsförsäkringsgruppens drivkraft inom sakförsäkring. Vi utvecklar nya affärer, skapar smarta försäkringslösningar och ser till att kunderna alltid har trygghet i vardagen. Vi står bakom gemensamma koncept, digital försäljning och kundkommunikation – och vi kompletterar bolagens erbjudanden med specialprodukter som gör skillnad.
   

  

 Hos oss får du vara med och forma framtidens försäkring – där innovation möter samhällsnytta.

title: Senior systemimplementatör inom Contact Center
description:
*Är du skicklig på att omsätta teknik till konkreta kundlösningar? Vill du jobba i ett tajt team där idéer värdesätts och där du får vara med och driva utveckling – både hos våra kunder och inom Advania? Då är det dig vi söker! Vi letar nu efter en Systemimplementatör till vårt team inom Customer Experience (CX), med placering på vårt kontor i Liljeholmen, Stockholm.* 




  





**Systemimplementatör på Advania 🚀** 




 Inom Advanias affärsområde Customer Experience (CX) levererar vi kontaktcenterplattformar från Genesys och Cisco till våra kunder. Vi är stolta över att vara Genesys enda guldpartner i Norden.
 



  





**Som Systemimplementatör hos oss arbetar du med:** 



* Att sätta upp molnbaserade kontaktcenterlösningar och integrera dessa mot kundens övriga plattformar.
* Att ha kunden i centrum, tillsammans med nordens skickligaste specialister inom området.



  





 Du ingår i ett team där vi både jobbar med implementation av standardiserade lösningar samt med utveckling av högspecialiserade lösningar för våra kunder såsom chat/voicebots, AI-assistans för kundens medarbetare och affärssystemsintegrationer. Hos oss har du möjlighet att utforska nya tekniker och lösningar och vi välkomnar nya idéer och initiativ för att driva arbetet framåt.
 



  





**Vad vi söker hos dig ✨** 




 Vi söker dig som kan utöka och komplettera vårt team på Advania CX, och hjälpa oss i vår strävan att kunna erbjuda den bästa kundupplevelsen. Du är trygg i din roll och har förmågan att anpassa dig efter olika kunder och situationer. För att du ska lyckas i rollen som Systemimplementatör ser vi att du har minst 3-6 års erfarenhet och kunskap inom några av följande områden:
 


* IP-telefoni / SIP / WebRTC
* Kontaktcenter
* Molntjänster såsom Google Cloud / AWS
* Integration av olika system



 Det är meriterande om du har:
 


* Erfarenhet av AI i kombination med kontaktcenter.
* Högskoleutbildning inom data/IT, alternativt att du har arbetat dig till likvärdig kompetens.



  





 För att du ska trivas som bäst hos oss ser vi att du är en engagerad, positiv och ansvarstagande person med ett brinnande intresse för att skapa framtidens lösningar för kundkommunikation.
 



 Du känner dig trygg i både det svenska och engelska språket, både i tal och skrift. Tjänsten innebär resor till kunder, både nationellt och internationellt.
 



  





**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋** 




 Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.
 



  





 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut. Advania samarbetar även med Ljung & Sjöberg för en proaktiv arbetsplats kopplat till alkohol och droger.
 



  





 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.

title: Analyst CIMIC and Critical Infrastructure to JATEC NATO
company: Swedish Civil Defence and Resilience Agency
description:
**Introduction**
 The Swedish Civil Defence and Resilience Agency recruits committed and skilled experts for our humanitarian, resilience and peace support operations worldwide on a daily basis. We have great experience on working together and strengthening other organisations for example the UN and the EU in crisis, conflicts or other disasters.
   

  

 The agency is currently looking to nominate an Analyst in Civil Military Cooperation (CIMIC) and Critical Infrastructure to the Joint Analysis Training and Education Centre (JATEC), NATO.
   

  

 JATEC is a pillar of the NATO-Ukraine relationship and an organisation providing analytical, educational and training capabilities to jointly identify and apply lessons from Russia’s war against Ukraine, and embedding these in strategy, policy, doctrine, tactics and operations; and to provide support to the successful achievement of interoperability objectives.
   

  

 The Analyst for CIMIC and Critical Infrastructure within the JATEC will be leading and contributing to actions that ensure coherence, including timeliness and accuracy, of Allied joint doctrine. In detail the incumbent should analyse, synthesise and operationalise lessons concerning civilian-military cooperation (CIMIC) from Russia’s war of aggression in Ukraine, including in the context of critical infrastructure resilience. These lessons will help to inform the work of JATEC in developing e.g., actionable strategies, training programmes, exercises and workshops with the aim of enhancing population protection, the resilience of critical infrastructure in conflict-affected environments, and the promotion of inclusive, whole-of-society engagement in stabilisation and post-conflict recovery efforts.
   

  

 Duty location: Bydgoszcz, Poland.
   

  

 Duration: 1 year with the possibility of extension.
   

  

 Start date: ASAP, as mutually agreed.
   

  

 The work is performed in a normal NATO office working environment.
   

  

 Normal working conditions apply.
   

  

 Employed by The Swedish Civil Defence and Resilience Agency on an international mission you will receive a monthly salary as well as a comprehensive allowances and benefits package, ranging from free home leave travel to access to psychosocial support.
   

  

 Please note that you have to be a Swedish Citizen to apply for this position.
   

  

**Duties**
 Lead the collection, analysis and dissemination of lessons learned from civil-military cooperation in Ukraine, engaging with the Ukrainian Armed Forces, government institutions, NGOs and international partners.
   

  

* Support Ukrainian and NATO stakeholders in strengthening resilience, safeguarding critical infrastructure, and advancing recovery initiatives in accordance with NATO’s Comprehensive Assistance Package (CAP), through a whole-of- government and whole-of-society approach grounded in NATO’s baseline resilience requirements.
* Facilitate inclusive civil-military dialogue platforms to foster interoperability, mutual trust, and coordinated responses between military entities and civil society actors.
* Coordinate closely with NATO bodies, Allies, and Ukrainian experts across public and private sectors in order to identify, interpret, and apply insights from civil-military experiences within the context of Russia’s war in Ukraine.
* Engage with IS OPS, NRU, NSATU, SHAPE, NATO CIMIC Centre of Excellence (COE) and other relevant NATO entities to explore, advise on, and implement innovative CIMIC approaches tailored to Ukraine’s conflict and post-conflict environment.
* Provide strategic guidance to JATEC on integrating CIMIC methodologies into its programme of work (POW), positioning it as a key venue for joint civil-military capacity building and operational coordination.
* Integrate the Women, Peace and Security (WPS) agenda and the NATO Climate Change and Security Action Plan across all training programmes, dialogue platforms, and operational engagements, advancing gender-responsive strategies, enhancing adaptation to climate-related security risks, and fostering inclusive, climate-aware peacebuilding.
* Maintain doctrine related working relations with NATO and Ukrainian entities.
* Represent JATEC at conferences, meetings, and visits.
* Provides input to review of Allied Administrative Publications and other guidance related to concept/doctrine development.


 Provide support to:
   

  

 Analysis of NATO’s strategic and operational environment;
   

  

 Identification of Ukrainian capability needs;
   

  

 Ongoing exercises and experimentation; and concepts under development.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Experience**
 Six years experience working with: national or international civil protection agencies, infrastructure operators or regulators (energy, transport, telecom), military or defence institutions in advisory or liaison roles, multinational organisations (e.g. NATO, EU, UN) in resilience or reconstruction contexts.
   

  

 Experience in civil-military coordination and critical infrastructure.
   

  

 Demonstrated ability to conduct analysis as well as to write clear and concise reports and other documents.
   

  

 Good knowledge and understanding of the situation in Ukraine.
   

  

 Knowledge of NATO’s organisation and policies is desirable.
   

  

 We place strong emphasis on personal qualities.
   

  

**Education**
 University degree in of one of the following fields: International Relations or Security Studies, Political Science or Public Administration, Civil Engineering or Infrastructure Management, Emergency Management or Disaster Risk Reduction, or other relevant areas.
   

  

**Languages**
 Fluency in English - Listening, Speaking, Reading and Writing.
   

  

**Other Requirements**
 This position will require a security clearance.
   

  

 The incumbent needs to be a Swedish citizen.
   

  

 Prior to employment a medical examination must be carried out and the results must be approved by The Swedish Civil Defence and Resilience Agency. Certain diseases and conditions can preclude international deployment. If you have any questions regarding the agency´s health requirements, please contact our medical coordinators, medical.coordinator@mcf.se
   

  

**Profile**
 The incumbent:
   

  

 must be capable of working harmoniously in a multinational environment. Capable of interacting with a wide variety of NATO and national actors. Capable of initiative at working level. Must be in good health and be prepared to travel within and outside NATO’s boundaries in support of the listed duties.
   

  

 is expected to have excellent analytical and communicative skills, show initiative and take both a hands-on and an analytical approach to tasks and problems.
   

  

 is expected to conduct in accordance with the current NATO Code of Conduct agreed by the North Atlantic Council (NAC), and thus display the core values of integrity, impartiality, loyalty, accountability, and professionalism.
   

  

 significantly impacts, both directly and indirectly, on the objectives of JATEC and NATO. The incumbent, through her/his work, provides the coherence between lessons learned, concepts, analysis, operations, exercises and doctrine development to deliver doctrine that enhances interoperability. Through the incumbents work, interoperability in NATO and alliance Nations is also directly and indirectly impacted.
   

  

**Contractual conditions**
 This position allows for accompanying family in accordance with the applicable regulations.
   

  

 If you wish to apply for this position you need to create an account on MyPages. Please note; the information that you provide on MyPages will form the basis for your CV. When you have created your account and registered your CV-details on MyPages you submit your application by clicking on the "Apply" button in the add, and the follow the specified steps. If you already have an account on Mypages you can go directly to the Apply-button. If you find any trouble with MyPages, please contact our Mypages support; mypages@mcf.se
   

  

 It is your responsibility as an applicant to document your skills in a way that allows an objective and qualitative assessment. As a government agency we are subject to the principle of public access to official records. This means that if someone requests copies of application documents, we are obliged to disclose them. If your identity is protected, you should contact the HR officer stated below, before registering any information on MyPages.
   

  

 The Swedish Civil Defence and Resilience Agency will process the applications on an ongoing basis during the application period, which means that we wish you to submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 We encourage you to write what date you are available and please note that your application needs to be in English.
   

  

 We welcome your application!
   

  

**Application deadline**
 2026-02-26
   

  

**Point of contact**
 Stina Nilsson
   

  

 stina.nilsson@mcf.se
   

  

 +46102405444

title: Staff Core Data
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 We are hiring a Staff Core Data to own how Mentimeter's products define, emit, and evolve data. This is a senior, hands-on systems role focused on product data semantics, canonical events, and architectural intent. The role is cross-cutting by design. While reporting into Engineering, the mandate spans Product, Data Platform, Analytics, AI, and GTM.
   

  

 This role exists to turn Mentimeter's product activity into a strategic asset by establishing Core Data as the connective tissue between products, insights, and decisions. This role does not run analytics or platforms. It defines meaning, standards, and direction.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Establish and evolve Core Data as a first class domain at Mentimeter, defining how product signals are captured, trusted, and turned into insights and decisions across the company
* Act as the founder and steward of Canonical Domain Events, ensuring they become the shared language between products, analytics, and decision making
* Define data contracts at emission, ensuring signals are consistent, trustworthy, and reusable
* Shape architecture intent for how product signals flow into analytics, AI, recommendations, and GTM systems further downstream
* Work closely with product and engineering teams to ensure features are designed with learning and signal quality in mind
* Enable governance through design. Clear models, strong defaults, and explicit tradeoffs rather than process or policing
* Act as a Staff-level reference point for Core Data design across the company


**Success criteria**
* Mentimeter shifts away from treating a single database as truth, instead grounding decisions in shared, trusted signals expressed through Canonical Domain Events
* New products and features natively emit Canonical Domain Events as part of normal development
* Core Data shortens the loop between product behavior and product decisions


**We believe you have**
* 8+ years of experience designing and owning data-heavy systems in product-led companies
* Strong systems thinking and comfort reasoning about boundaries, contracts, and long-term evolution
* Hands-on technical credibility. You can read, write, and reason about production code and data models
* Experience working close to product teams, shaping instrumentation and learning loops at the source
* Ability to translate complex systems into clear models others can follow
* Comfort operating in ambiguity and driving clarity through action


**What This Role Is Not**
* Not a reporting or analytics role
* Not a data platform operations role
* Not a Martech or GTM tooling role
* Not a people-management-first role


**Not Required**
 Swedish is not required (as daily work is carried out in English and the Mentimeter team currently boasts 50+ different nationalities)
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**AI and Hiring at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter, we believe AI helps us work smarter - but it never replaces the human assessment, curiosity, and personal connection that define our culture and our hiring. We use AI as a sparring partner: to bounce ideas, bring new perspectives, support structure, and make our work more efficient. But the meaning, decisions, and interactions always come from people.
   

  

* AI does not screen or decide on candidates.
* There is no automated filtering, ranking, or decision-making in our recruitment process. Every application is reviewed by a person.
* Hiring teams may use AI to support their work - for example, to structure notes, prepare interview questions, or organize their thinking.


 AI strengthens our work, but it does not define it. At Mentimeter, we’re not building an AI-driven hiring process - we’re building a people-first culture, where technology helps us listen, learn, and grow together.
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
*Vi söker dig som vill vara med och bygga framtidens dataplattformar säkra, skalbara och smarta lösningar som gör skillnad på riktigt. Hos oss på Advania får du arbeta i en central roll med stort tekniskt inflytande, i ett team där din erfarenhet värderas högt och där vi tillsammans ger människor kraften att skapa hållbara värden genom teknik.*
 Senior Data Engineer hos oss arbetar du nära både teknik och verksamhet. Du tar ansvar för utvecklingen av vår datainfrastruktur, driver arkitekturfrågor och är med och formar riktningen framåt i molnet och i hybridmiljöer.
   

  

 Senior Data Engineer på Advania 🚀
   

  

 Som Senior Data Engineer ansvarar du för att designa, utveckla och förvalta våra dataplattformar och pipelines både i molnet och i hybridmiljöer. Du arbetar med att bygga och vidareutveckla Lakehouse arkitekturer, säkra integrationer mellan on-prem och moln, samt skapa stabila och tillförlitliga dataflöden i produktion.
   

  

 Du har en viktig roll i att optimera prestanda, datasäkerhet och kvalitet i våra lösningar. Det innebär också att du arbetar nära verksamheten för att förstå databehov och omsätta dem till robusta tekniska lösningar. Som senior förväntas du bidra till våra tekniska riktlinjer och vara ett stöd för andra ingenjörer i teamet både genom kodgranskning, kunskapsdelning och diskussioner kring arkitektur.
   

  

 🔹 Du coachar och stöttar andra ingenjörer och är en teknisk förebild
   

  

 🔹 Du samarbetar tvärfunktionellt med arkitekter, analytiker och affärsrepresentanter
   

  

 Du blir en del av ett erfaret och sammansvetsat team med data engineers, arkitekter och plattformspecialister. Vi arbetar agilt, med dagliga standups, kodgranskningar, designsessioner och tät kommunikation. Du har en nyckelroll i att både utveckla lösningar och påverka helheten vi litar på din erfarenhet och din vilja att driva förbättringar.
   

  

 Vi samarbetar tätt med affärssidan, IT, säkerhetsfunktioner och externa partners, där du får möjlighet att vara med och påverka hela kedjan från behov till verklig nytta.
   

  

 Vad vi söker hos dig ✨
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är en erfaren dataingenjör med både djup teknisk kompetens och en stark känsla för helhet och ansvar. Du har flera års erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataplattformar i produktion gärna i komplexa miljöer där både on-prem och moln ingår och du trivs med att kombinera hands-on utveckling med arkitektoniska vägval.
   

  

 Du har god förståelse för distribuerad databehandling, framför allt med Spark eller liknande ramverk, och du har byggt pipelines som verkligen används inte bara som proof of concept. Du programmerar gärna i Python eller Scala och har jobbat med moderna arkitekturer som Lakehouse och Data Lakes. Vi tror också att du har vana att arbeta i molnmiljöer som Azure, AWS eller GCP, och att du har koll på IAM, nätverk och säkerhet i en dataingenjörskontext.
   

  

 🔹 Flerårig erfarenhet av produktion och drift av dataflöden
   

  

 🔹 Goda kunskaper inom datamodellering, SQL och dataarkitektur
   

  

 🔹 Du är trygg i att ta tekniskt ledarskap och att stötta kollegor
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har jobbat med Databricks, Terraform, Kubernetes, Airflow eller realtidsdata. Har du dessutom erfarenhet från reglerade miljöer, som offentlig sektor eller finans, så är det ett plus men inte ett krav.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋
   

  

 Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.
   

  

 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut. Advania samarbetar även med Ljung & Sjöberg för en proaktiv arbetsplats kopplat till alkohol och droger.
   

  

 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.
   

  

 Det är du som arbetar nära kunden som vet vad dem behöver och vad som blir den bästa lösningen för just deras unika behov, både i dag och i morgon. Därför tycker vi att det är du som ska fatta besluten. Det är genom att erbjuda säkra, hållbara och kundanpassade lösningar som vi skapar värde för kunderna och samhället i stort.
   

  

 Vi bryr oss om hur våra medarbetare mår – på riktigt. Därför samarbetar Advania med Ljung & Sjöberg för att skapa en trygg, proaktiv arbetsmiljö med stöd kring alkohol-, drog- och beroenderelaterade frågor. Tillsammans bygger vi en hållbar arbetsplats där det är okej att be om hjälp, och där förebyggande arbete gör skillnad – för individen, teamet och företaget.
   

  

 I en miljö präglad av stort kundfokus och frihet under ansvar blir det extra viktigt för oss att bygga starka team bestående av ödmjuka stjärnor. Att arbeta i en inkluderande miljö, med kollegor och kunder som vill utvecklas, ger oss möjligheten att trivas och ha riktigt roligt på jobbet. Vi tror på en platt organisation med agilt arbetssätt och flexibilitet. Detta är det enda sättet för en hållbar framtid.
   

  

 Advania Sverige, ”The tech company with people at heart”, har kontor över hela landet, från Luleå i norr till Malmö i syd. Dagligen hjälper våra 1 700 specialister våra kunder, både inom privat och offentlig sektor, i deras ambitioner och mål att digitalisera sina verksamheter. Genom långsiktiga relationer, ledande teknologier, moderna plattformslösningar och strategiska partnerskap formar vi framtidens IT-landskap. Vårt syfte sträcker sig bortom teknik: att ge människor kraften att skapa hållbara värden.
   

  

 Advaniagruppen levererar tjänster till kunder i Sverige, Norge, Storbritannien, Island, Finland och Danmark inom hållbar och säker digitalisering.

title: Handläggare signalskydd till Must
description:
**Vill du ha ett meningsfullt arbete och bidra till ett säkrare Sverige i en osäker värld?**
 Det förändrade omvärldsläget medför att vårt försvar behöver förstärkas och den ökade underrättelseverksamheten mot Sverige och Försvarsmakten är omfattande. Militära underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänsten (Must) bedriver försvarsunderrättelseverksamhet och militär underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänst till stöd för svensk utrikes-, försvars- och säkerhetspolitik samt i övrigt för kartläggning av yttre hot mot Sverige.
   

  

**Vårt erbjudande**
 Vi erbjuder ett viktigt och stimulerande arbete där du dagligen bidrar till Sveriges säkerhet. Vi erbjuder också mycket goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling. Hos oss finns det friskvårdsmöjligheter som inkluderar träning tre timmar i veckan på arbetstid samt möjlighet att ha balans mellan fritid och arbete.
   

  

**Om enheten**
 Kontoret för informationsteknologi (KIT) vid Must ansvarar för utveckling, förvaltning och drift av Must informationssystem. Kontoret bidrar till Must förmåga genom att realisera informationssystem och informationstjänster som stöd till Must underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänst. KIT stab samordnar verksamheten vid kontoret och stödjer kontorets tekniska avdelningar avseende ansvaret för Must informationssystem.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 Som Signalskyddshandläggare vid KIT kommer du få ett brett arbetsområde där signalskydd står för huvuddelen. Övriga uppgifter är att vara behjälplig i säkerhets- och IT-säkerhetsfrågor, och på sikt även kunna agera som kontorets säkerhetsperson. Tjänsten är placerad vid kontorets stab, som samordnar kontorets verksamhet och stödjer kontorsledningen.
   

  

 Som Signalskyddshandläggare vid KIT samordnar du uppdrag och ärenden inom kontoret såväl som mot centrala områdesfunktioner inom Must. Arbetet omfattar planering, uppföljning och löpande samordning inom signalskydds- och säkerhetsområdet.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Relevant akademisk examen, alternativt motsvarande kompetens förvärvat utifrån yrkeserfarenhet inom eller utanför Försvarsmakten.
* Utbildad kort- eller nyckeladministratör vid TSS


**Meriterande**
* Några års erfarenhet inom signalskyddsområdet
* Grundkurs Signalskydd, T2
* Erfarenhet av kort-/nyckeladministration, samt certorder
* Erfarenhet av TSA och KaP rutiner i ISUS
* God kunskap om PKI
* Signalskyddschefsutbildning, TSS Ch FM/CIV
* Erfarenhet av arbete som NAV och NBV eller motsv. formell utbildning från TSS
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom lednings-/sambandsfunktion inom FM
* Bred kunskap om IT- och nätverkssäkerhet.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med säkerhetsskydd och IT-säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av arbete vid statlig myndighet
* Kunskap om Försvarsmaktens verksamhet i allmänhet samt underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänst i synnerhet
* Vi ser gärna att du söker tjänsten även om du inte uppfyller samtliga meriterande kompetenser ovan, då det finns möjligheter inom Försvarsmakten och Must att komplettera efterfrågad kompetens efter tillträde.


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Som person är du självgående, noggrann och har gott ordningssinne. Du har överblick men släpper inte fokus från detaljerna. Du är lugn men har också förmåga att växla tempo då situationen kräver det.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är strukturerad och systematisk. Du är duktig på att kommunicera på ett pedagogiskt och tydligt sätt som ger kollegor förutsättningar att få en överblick av arbetsläge och vägen framåt. Du trivs med att samarbeta och är en god lyssnare i dialogen med andra. Du är prestigelös som person och med personlig mognad, pålitlighet och hög integritet skapar du förtroende för ditt arbete. Ett verifierat och stabilt säkerhetsmedvetande karaktäriserar dig som person.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har ett flexibelt förhållningssätt och kan ta egna initiativ för att lösa uppkomna problem. Du är även intresserad av att bidra i arbetet med att utveckla arbetssätt och metoder.
   

  

 Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Ovan ställda kvalifikationer ska på begäran kunna verifieras genom intyg, referenser samt arbets- eller urvalstester.
   

  

*För att myndighetens uppdrag ska vara framgångsrikt förutsätts att alla medarbetare uppträder enligt den värdegrund som finns. Försvarsmaktens värdegrund slår vakt om alla människors lika värde, rättvisa och jämlikhet och främjar demokrati och mänskliga rättigheter (läs mer på www.forsvarsmakten.se).*
**Övrigt**
 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning som inleds med provanställning om sex månader
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Arbetsort: Stockholm
   

  

 Tjänsten kräver arbete på plats och det finns därmed inte möjlighet till distansarbete.
   

  

**För upplysningar om befattningen eller rekryteringsprocessen kontakta:**
 hkv-rekrytering-must@mil.se, vänligen skriv ”Signalskyddshandläggare” i ämnesraden.
   

  

**Fackliga företrädare**
 Fackliga representanter nås via hkv-rekrytering-must@mil.se
   

  

*Varmt välkommen med din ansökan senast 2026-02-09. I ditt CV och personliga brev vill vi att du beskriver på vilket sätt du uppfyller våra efterfrågade krav och meriter. Du ansöker via* 
*jobb.forsvarsmakten.se. Urval sker löpande.*
 ,
 **Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.** 
 -------------------------------------------------------- Militära underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänsten (Must) är en del av Försvarsmaktens högkvarter i Stockholm. Vi ger regeringen och Försvarsmakten kvalificerade beslutsunderlag om omvärldsutvecklingen och hot mot Sveriges och Försvarsmaktens säkerhet. Vår vision är ”Ett säkrare Sverige i en osäker värld”. Must är en kunskapsorganisation och erbjuder både spännande och för Sverige angelägna arbetsuppgifter. Här arbetar både officerare och civila experter inom olika områden, t ex statsvetenskap, IT, ekonomi, teknik, matematik och HR. En stor del av Must verksamhet omfattas av sekretess och vi ber dig därför att inte berätta att du sökt jobb hos Must för andra personer än dina närmaste. Läs gärna mer om Must och vår verksamhet här Varje dag och varje timme gör våra medarbetare insatser som påverkar andra människors liv, både i stort och smått, och både på hemmaplan och runt om i världen. Försvarsmakten ger dig möjlighet att utvecklas som människa och växa i din professionella roll. Vi är en ansvarstagande arbetsgivare och har en öppen organisation där vi ställer upp för varandra. I Försvarsmakten finns en stark värdegrund som bygger på öppenhet, resultat och ansvar. Professionell utveckling och personlig hälsa värdesätts och uppmuntras. Det finns goda förutsättningar för intern karriärrörlighet, friskvård och bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Försvarsmakten tillvaratar de kvaliteter som mångfald och jämn könsfördelning tillför verksamheten. Vi välkomnar därför sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter i våra rekryteringar. En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. I anställningen ingår även en skyldighet att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Test Automation QA Engineer, Native
description:
**About the Company** 




  





 At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it. FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day. We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field. Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?
 



  





**About the Role** 




  





 At FDJ United, collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning drive everything we do. As part of the iOS team, you'll join a supportive environment where engineers learn from each other, challenge assumptions, and shape the future of our products. We're looking for a Test Automation QA Engineer with strong experience in mobile automation and CI/CD, based in Stockholm or Madrid, to strengthen our native development capability. You'll contribute directly to high-quality, stable releases across brands while helping evolve our automation strategy and tooling. As part of a regulated group committed to safe and sustainable entertainment, we take reliability, compliance, and responsible development seriously. Every team member helps ensure we maintain a safe, high-quality environment for our players.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Develop, maintain, and evolve test automation frameworks for our native apps across multiple brands.
* Design, implement, and execute automated functional, UI, and performance tests to support a high-quality release pipeline.
* Use manual testing as a last resort for edge cases or new features not yet automated.
* Collaborate closely with native developers, Product Owners, architects, and backend/frontend peers in a highly cross-functional setup.
* Participate in design discussions, influencing testing strategy, technical decisions, and best practices.
* Take part in the full software lifecycle, ensuring reliability, monitoring, and continuous improvement through CI/CD.
* Troubleshoot issues, identify root causes, and help drive solutions across teams.
* Support releases and maintain appropriate versioning and documentation.
* Ensure adherence to Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations: raising non-compliance concerns, completing mandatory training, and challenging processes that could introduce risk.
* Drive quality culture by suggesting improvements to tools, processes, and overall product experience.



  





**Required Skills** 




  




* Excellent skills with Appium, Cypress, Cucumber, Selenium, and experience with CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins).
* Solid test automation development skills in Python, Java & JavaScript.
* Ability to plan and execute tests across functional, UX, performance, and integration dimensions.
* Experience working in Agile teams with modern development processes.
* Understanding of secure development principles and awareness of OWASP practices.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to both give and receive constructive feedback.
* Experience acting as Incident Manager or handling production-related quality issues.
* Comfortable participating in releases and ensuring production reliability.
* Ability to troubleshoot complex problems and think critically about product quality.



  





**Preferred Skills** 




  




* Experience using Groovy, Bash, Ruby for automation development.
* Familiarity with visual testing, API testing, or cloud device testing (e.g., TestObject, BrowserStack).
* Experience designing high-performance, scalable test applications.

title: Embedded Hardware Developer
description:
Are you passionate about designing reliable, secure, and future-ready embedded electronics that power innovative products? ASSA ABLOY is looking for an experienced and forward-thinking Embedded Hardware Developer to play a key role in developing the next generation of our electronic solutions. Based in Stockholm, Sweden you will help build robust, scalable, and high-quality hardware that enables secure and seamless product performance trusted by customers worldwide. In this role, you'll thrive in a collaborative, innovative culture that empowers you to build a career to be proud of.
   

  

**What You Will Do As Our Embedded Hardware Developer**
 As our Embedded Hardware Developer, you will design, develop, and validate hardware solutions that meet demanding requirements for performance, security, and reliability. You will take responsibility from concept and schematic design through PCB layout review, prototyping, testing, documentation, and final validation for production readiness, while working closely with firmware and cross-functional engineering teams.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Design and develop embedded electronics and PCB solutions, including schematic capture and layout reviews
* Select and integrate suitable microcontrollers, sensors, components, and communication interfaces (SPI, I²C, UART, CAN, etc.)
* Conduct testing, debugging, optimization, and validation to ensure quality, reliability, and production readiness
* Ensure compliance with industry standards, including EMC/EMI considerations and best-practice design principles
* Collaborate closely with firmware and interdisciplinary teams while documenting designs and contributing to continuous improvement


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* 3+ years of experience working with embedded hardware development and PCB design.
* Hands-on experience with atleast one modern PCB design tool (Altium, KiCad, or similar).
* Good knowledge of microcontrollers and embedded systems, plus experience with some relevant communication protocols (for example SPI, I²C, UART, or CAN).
* Experience with hardware testing, debugging, and validation — ideally including EMC/EMI awareness.
* Fluency in English (both spoken and written).


 The ideal candidate is a collaborative and open-minded engineer who enjoys working closely with others to solve complex challenges. You are structured, analytical, and take pride in delivering reliable, high-quality results. With strong problem-solving skills and a keen attention to detail, you approach tasks with curiosity, ownership, and a practical mindset, ensuring designs are both technically sound and fit for real-world production.
   

  

**We review applications regularly, so don't wait.**
 We are building diverse and inclusive teams and encourage applications from all who can envision themselves working with us.
   

  

 To ensure that your personal information is secure, we do not review any applications sent via email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, please send an email to Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at Khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com .
   

  

 Let's together create a safer and more open world!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com.
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Franchisetagare till Stockholm
description:
**Nytt år, nya jobbmöjligheter? 🚀**
**Vi söker nu franchisetagare till flera områden i Stockholm.** 
 Hos oss blir du en del av en kedja som växer och tar marknadsandelar medan du läser den här annonsen.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder:** 
 Som franchisetagare blir du en del av vårt framgångsrika team och stöttas av vårt starka varumärke. Du erbjuds stöd och ett nära samarbete med vår regionchef. Vi har även ett fulltäckande servicebolag som hjälper dig med allt från juridiska frågor, IT, marknads- eller personalfrågor. Vi erbjuder också kontinuerlig utveckling för våra ledare för att ge dig rätt förutsättningar. Vi tror på långsiktigt samarbete och söker därför dig som vill driva ditt eget bolag mot nya höjder tillsammans med oss.
   

  

**Vem är du?** 
 Vi söker dig som har mäklat i några år och är redo att axla en större roll. Vi ser gärna att du är en ödmjuk vinnarskalle som har en tydlig vision och kommer att jobba hårt för att nå dina mål. Du bör vara affärsorienterad och företagsam för att passa in i rollen som franchisetagare. Det är även viktigt att du värdesätter teamkänsla och trivs i ledarrollen.
   

  

* Det är ett krav att du är registrerad fastighetsmäklare.
* Det är meriterande om du tidigare drivit bolag


**Vilka är vi?** 
 Vi är idag den näst största mäklarkedjan i Sverige – vi är stolta, men inte nöjda. Vi har en tydlig målsättning att bli den ledande mäklarkedjan och söker därför dig som vill vara med på resan. Vårt varumärke har redan gjort halva jobbet – med bank, försäkring & fastighetsförmedling under samma tak.
   

  

**Låter detta som en matchning för dig?** 
 Träffa oss på ett förutsättningslöst samtal eller fika! ☕️ Vi jobbar med löpande urval och all kontakt är konfidentiell.
   

  

 Thomas Persson
   

  

 Kontaktperson
   

  

 Ansök nu
   

  

 0734-410 411
   

  

 Maila Thomas Persson

title: Power Platform Management Consultant | Modern Workplace
description:
**Summary**
 Unlock the potential of Power Platform as a visionary engineer, transforming challenges into cutting-edge solutions. Embrace continuous learning and collaborate with global teams to shape the future of technology-driven excellence. Join us at Avanade, where creativity, innovation, and career growth thrive.
   

  

 Are you a visionary Power Platform Engineer with a track record of designing and implementing cutting-edge solutions? You thrive on transforming business challenges into powerful automated solutions, and your attention to detail sets you apart. Embrace your passion for continuous learning and seize the opportunity to deliver top-tier results under pressure. Join us as we shape the future with technology-driven excellence!
 **Together we do what matters.**
**Key Responsibilities**
 As a Power Platform Management Consultant, your focus is on Power Platform solutions within the Workplace services field. Day to day you will design and implement Power Platform applications to meet client requirements. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams under challenging circumstances to deliver high-quality solutions. You will apply your expertise in the Power Platform and Microsoft 365 suite of products translating business requirements into technical deliverables, estimating and managing timing, workforce and demand supply process, and addressing task backlog as well as unit testing phasis for continuous improvement of client solutions. You will share best practices for Power Platform solutions with global Avanade team members and attend partner events for knowledge and delivery model sharing.
   

  

 Some of the best things about working at Avanade
   

  

* Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14


 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!
 **Together we do what matters.**
 We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our Inclusion & Diversity page.
   

  

 Create a future for our people that focuses on
   

  

* Expanding your thinking
* Experimenting courageously
* Learning and pivoting


 Inspire greatness in our people by
   

  

* Empowering every voice
* Encouraging boldness
* Celebrating progress


 Accelerate the impact of our people by
   

  

* Amazing the client
* Prioritizing what matters
* Acting as one


**Qualifications**
 You have previous and solid experience with:
   

  

* Designing and developing Power Automate flows.
* Applying strong business analysis methodology and requirements-gathering skills.
* Implementing agile development practices.
* Showing a critical thinking problem-solving and troubleshooting skills approach.
* Creating, analyzing, and visualizing data with Power BI.
* Using Dataverse with Power Platform solutions.
* Securing apps and data with the latest and most robust techniques.


 You’re a natural communicator who wants to help our partners on their Power Platform implementation journey. You will help improve employee mobility, efficiency, teamwork, and security demonstrating your experience in Microsoft 365 suite. Your interpersonal and communication skills help technical and non-technical clients engage with often complex information.
   

  

**Characteristics That Can Spell Success For This Role Are**
* Embrace challenges with a keen intellect and a thirst for knowledge.
* Collaborate seamlessly, fostering open and effective communication.
* Embrace creativity and explore groundbreaking solutions.
* Stay ahead of the curve, anticipating what lies ahead and adapting to the latest advancements.

title: Credit Officer
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most. With strong backing, a flat organization, and bold growth plans, we’re now looking for a German Speaking Credit Officer to join us and shape the future of small business owners.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Credit Officer, you will play an important role in managing and making decisions on large and complex credits in our seven different markets. This role involves conducting ad-hoc analyses, monitoring the overall loan and card portfolio, and contributing to compliance and credit-focused projects. The Credit Officer acts as a support function for our country-specific Underwriters, providing expert guidance and feedback on credit-related tasks. You’ll also be responsible for educating and updating underwriters on Qred’s procedures and closely monitoring the progress and quality of credit decisions. In this role, you will work in close collaboration with the other Credit Officers, and report directly to our Credit Officer Manager.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Support country-specific functions in decisions regarding large and/or complex credits per the credit policy, with a focus on our German market.
* Alert country-specific teams to additional information that may be needed to make well-founded decisions
* Identify areas for improvement within our assessment strategies
* Drive internal and external projects to improve Credit decisions
* Extract data from our database to analyze, evaluate trends, and perform controls
* Contribute feedback to develop our automated services, primarily our Qred Scoring Algorithm (QSA)


**Requirements**
* At least 2 years of relevant work experience
* Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or comparable experience within the required field
* Strong understanding of financial documentation like profit and loss statements and annual reports
* Basic understanding of accounting principles
* Proficiency in Underwriting
* Fluent in English and German, both written and spoken
* Excel skills (formula creation and ad-hoc analysis of exported data)


 Skills and competencies that will make you stand out from the rest
   

  

* Experience in the German or Austrian credit/financial market
* Proficiency in Dutch, Swedish, French, or Finnish
* Project management experience
* SQL skills


**Why join us?**
 This is a unique opportunity to join a growing fintech company that is redefining financial services for small businesses in Northern Europe. You’ll work with a passionate and innovative team, participating in creating an environment where employees thrive and contribute to a shared vision of success.
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Deployment Strategist
description:
**Founding Deployment Strategist**
 TL;DR: We're looking for a Founding Deployment Strategist to guide Lovable users from first value to full adoption. You'll build trusted relationships, help customers ship faster, and turn every account into a success story by diving deep into their workflows, partnering with their teams, and shaping how our platform solves their most critical challenges.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone build software with AI. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, over 2 million people in 200+ countries use Lovable to transform ideas into real products—fast. We're at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change how the digital world works.
   

  

 We're a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Boston and Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity, and low-ego collaboration. We seek people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
 Experience in Customer Success, account management, or solution consulting in SaaS or AI products
   

  

 Track record of driving adoption, renewals, and expansion across Enterprise and Strategic accounts
   

  

 Technical ability to collaborate with technical teams to scope, architect, and deploy custom solutions at scale
   

  

 Strong communicator who translates technical capabilities into clear business outcomes
   

  

 Skilled at running onboarding, QBRs, and success plans with multiple stakeholders
   

  

* Comfortable with ambiguity and iteration in a fast-moving, high-growth environment
* Bonus: Experience supporting developer tools or AI-native products


**What You'll Do**
 Drive Customer Success & Adoption
   

  

 Own post-sale success: onboarding, adoption, renewal, and expansion for key accounts
   

  

 Build and execute success plans aligned with customer goals and product capabilities
   

  

 Drive value realization through proactive check-ins, QBRs, and enablement sessions
   

  

 Track health scores, usage, and adoption metrics to identify risks and opportunities
   

  

 Act as a strategic advisor—guiding customers on best practices, new features, and workflows
   

  

 Collaborate Cross-Functionally
   

  

 Partner with Forward Deployment Engineers to scope, prototype, and deliver customer solutions
   

  

 Collaborate with Product and Engineering to surface feedback and shape roadmap priorities
   

  

 Work with Account Executives to identify and qualify expansion opportunities
   

  

 Troubleshoot blockers, coordinate internal support, and ensure fast resolution
   

  

 Build Customer Success playbooks and processes based on learnings
   

  

 Partner Deeply with Customers
   

  

 Embed with customer teams to understand their workflows, goals, and pain points
   

  

 Identify and interpret key datasets that drive decision-making and integrate them into scalable solutions
   

  

 Design and refine user workflows that solve meaningful problems across teams and functions
   

  

 Lead training and onboarding sessions to ensure lasting impact and user success
   

  

 Present findings and strategy to stakeholders from frontline operators to C-suite executives
   

  

**What Success Looks Like**
 Customers reach time-to-value fast and expand use across teams
   

  

 Lovable becomes mission-critical to how customers build and innovate
   

  

* You're seen as the bridge between customers, product, and growth


**About Your Application**
 Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
   

  

 We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal.

title: HR Business Partner
description:
We are looking for an
 **HR Business Partner** 
 to work closely with managers and leadership teams across the business as a trusted and pragmatic people partner.
   

  

 This role is suited for someone with
 **solid HRBP experience** 
 who is comfortable operating independently, advising leaders, and balancing day-to-day people support with longer-term organizational capability building.
   

  

 The role combines
 **hands-on HR Business Partnering with strategic responsibility** 
 for talent development, succession planning, and performance management.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

* Act as the primary HR partner and advisor for assigned departments
* Partner closely with managers and leaders on people-related matters
* Translate departmental priorities into relevant people actions and plans
* Coach and support managers in leadership, people management, and employee matters
* Lead and manage employee cases in line with legislation and best practice
* Deliver core employee lifecycle activities (e.g. engagement surveys and follow-ups)
* Use people data and insights to identify risks, trends, and improvement opportunities
* Handle relevant HR administration


**Alongside your departmental responsibilities** 
 , you will take a broader role in shaping and driving key people capabilities across the organization:
   

  

* Lead or significantly contribute to talent development initiatives and career planning
* Drive succession planning for critical roles
* Strengthen performance management practices (goal setting, feedback, reviews, performance improvement)
* Support managers in applying consistent and effective performance processes
* Contribute to frameworks, tools, and processes within talent, succession, and performance
* Use people data and insights to identify capability gaps and evaluate development initiatives


 We believe that you have
   

  

* 2-5 years of experience as an HR Business Partner, HR Generalist, or similar business facing HR role
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in HR, Business Administration, or a related field
* Hands-on experience within talent development, succession planning, and/or performance management
* Strong knowledge of employment law and HR best practices (multi-jurisdictional experience is an advantage)
* Strong communication, coaching, and stakeholder management skills
+ Fluent in English (additional languages are a plus)

* Strong analytical skills and confidence working with people's data


 We are looking for someone who is
   

  

* Comfortable working independently, both strategically and hands-on in a dynamic environment
* Confident and credible when working with managers and leaders, advising and challenging when needed
* Structured, pragmatic, and solutions-oriented
* Curious and thoughtful with data, using insights to inform decisions and spot patterns
* Comfortable balancing operational demands with longer-term capabilities
* Genuinely interested in people, teams, and building a strong, sustainable organization


**Life at Relax**
 Are you ready to join a creative, forward-thinking team shaping the future of iGaming? At Relax, we value curiosity, diversity, and the courage to challenge limits. With 350+ colleagues across 10+ locations, we combine stability with constant evolution, driven by passion and teamwork. Relax offers an environment where you can grow, learn, and make real impact. Collaboration is central to how we work, and our success comes from the talent and dedication of our people.
   

  

 If you’re motivated by quality, results, and meaningful connections, you’ll fit right in. No matter where you’re based, you’ll find the same supportive, respectful, and ambitious spirit that defines Relax Gaming.
   

  

**About Relax Gaming**
 Relax Gaming Group was founded in 2010 with the goal of simplifying B2B content delivery for the modern iGaming landscape. With business simplicity and collaboration central to its ethos. Via a quick one-time integration, Relax Gaming now provides access to a roster of 4,000+ casino games to 1,000+ operator brands with a diverse range of proprietary products, including Poker, Bingo, and it's own extensive slot portfolio. High-quality aggregated content from multiple partner studios, is
   

  

 provided through its selected Silver Bullet (commercially represented) and Powered By Relax (commercially independent) partners.

title: Business Development Manager
description:
Do you have a solid business acumen and the ability to foresee opportunities and challenges? Does your problem solving and interpersonal skills enable you to be a trusted advisor of senior executives? Join our global team in Stockholm, Sweden, and enjoy a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
 



  





 ASSA ABLOY Group is the global leader in access solutions. The Group operates worldwide with 63,000 employees and sales of over EUR 13 billion. The Group has leading positions in areas such as efficient door openings, trusted identities and entrance automation.
 



  





**What will you do as our Business Development Manager** 




 You will drive Group-wide projects withing strategy and business development, as well as supporting in delivering market insights to senior stakeholder to the group. In these projects you will work closely with Commercial and M&A Development in all divisions as well as with Director of Strategy and Business Development and Group Chief Commercial Officer.
 



 In this role you will regularly interact with the members of the Group Management and get exposed to senior leaders within the Group which offers great career opportunities for future General Management positions or functional roles.
 



  





**You would also:** 



* Support the Group strategy development process by creating presentations for internal and external stakeholders and by driving or facilitating strategy workshops and sessions.
* Collaborate with key stakeholders within the group innovation and group sustainability team
* Evaluate new business opportunities through the development of strategic reports and market studies for new markets or product areas.
* Establish and maintain insights through analysis of industry, market and customer trends, and competitors ’ activities.
* Support planning and execution of yearly group strategy conference for top leaders across the group
* Project manage Group-wide development projects in areas such as branding, AI, communications and more



  





**We are looking for someone who has:** 



* 3-5 years of management consulting or business development experience in a similar or adjacent industry, e.g. security, construction, industrial goods, etc.
* Master degree in engineering and/or business/finance/economics.
* Experience from projects within strategy, due diligence and sales & marketing
* Strong problem-solving capabilities
* Ability to influence complicated and delicate business issues through extensive internal -and sometimes external- interactions.
* Good interpersonal skills, with tact and diplomacy to ensure successful delivery of projects.
* Strong communication skills, ability to interact at all levels of the organisation.
* Proficiency in English and a Scandinavian language, both written and spoken, required. Other languages a clear plus given the global nature of the role.
* Position may involve travel according to project type and duration.



  





 Experience working with international, cross-functional, and cross-cultural teams or have lived and worked in other countries is considered a plus but not a prerequisite.
 



  





**We review applications regularly, so don’t wait!** 




 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply,no later than
 **1st of February.** 
 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Camilla Heneby, Executive Search, at camilla.heneby@assaabloy.com
 



  





**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group** 




 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
 



 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
 



 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Senior Media Manager
description:
**THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL**
**You?** 
 A senior, analytical media expert who thrives at the intersection of strategy, data, and creativity, and who wants to shape how some of the Nordics’ strongest brands invest in media.
   

  

**Role?** 
 Senior Media Manager (Nordic Media Buyer) owning and evolving media investments across multiple Nordic marketplaces, driving impact through smart strategy, deep analysis, and bold decision-making.
   

  

**Company?** 
 Vend, home of FINN, Blocket, DBA, Bilbasen, Oikotie & Tori, where millions of people across the Nordics connect to find what they need, whether it’s a way to move, a job, a home, a way to move, or a fresh start.
   

  

**Location?** 
 Join us in our Oslo or Stockholm office, with the flexibility to work 50% remotely, your choice, your balance.
   

  

**Why us?** 
 This is your chance to make a visible impact on how some of the Nordics’ strongest brands invest in media. You’ll work with solid budgets, take strategic decisions that matter, and do so in a fast-learning environment where creativity, experimentation, and results go hand in hand.
   

  

*Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!*
**WHO ARE YOU?**
* Solid experience from a media agency or advertiser, ideally in a Nordic setup.
* Strong analytical mindset: confident working with numbers, insights, and performance measurement.
* Marketing Mix Modelling (MMM) experience, with the ambition to move from measurement to prediction.
* AI-initiative and proficiency to improve processes, analysis, reporting, and decision-making.
* You are fluent in English, our official company language. Knowledge of Norwegian or Swedish is a strong asset, as you’ll collaborate closely with local media partners and creative teams.
* As a person, you’re structured and accountable: people rely on you in complex, cross-team environments. Collaborative and curious, eager to understand markets, challenge partners, and drive change.


**WHAT’S THE JOB LIKE?**
 Your mission is to ensure Vend’s Nordic media investments deliver maximum impact (today and long term) by combining strong strategy, data-driven decisions, and continuous optimisation.
   

  

 What your days will look like
   

  

* Plan, buy, and optimise media investments across FINN, Blocket, DBA, and Bilbasen
* Act as the partner and challenger to our external media agency
* Drive the development and execution of the Nordic media strategy
* Analyse campaign performance and media effectiveness across digital and offline channels
* Work actively with MMM, budget allocation, CAC & LTV insights
* Introduce and scale AI solutions in media planning, reporting, and analysis
* Own budget oversight and invoice approvals
* Track trends, test new opportunities, and bring innovation into the media mix
* Present insights, results, and recommendations to management and marketing teams


**Key Stakeholders**
* Nordic marketing teams
* Media agency partners
* Management and senior decision-makers
* Growth and analytics colleagues across Vend


**A FEW WORDS FROM YOUR FUTURE MANAGER, HANNE LILL JOHNSEN**
*“Hi there, this is Hanne!*
*You will join the Media & Growth team, based in a central unit called the Center of Excellence. We currently consist of two senior specialists across the Nordics, based in Stockholm and Denmark, whereas I am based in Oslo. As a team, we work closely with local markets and play a strategic role in shaping how Vend invests in media. What I appreciate the most about our team is that we collaborate transparently, challenge each other constructively, and value learning over perfection.*
*If this resonates with you, we want to hear from you!”*
 Want to get a feel for our culture and what drives us? Take a peek behind the scenes at our Career Page!
   

  

**GOT YOUR ATTENTION? LET US HEAR FROM YOU!**
 Make sure to apply by
 **Sunday, 8th of February** 
 .
   

  

 You can choose whether to send your cover letter or go through some questions we prepared to get to know you better :)
   

  

 We will start with the first rounds of interviews after the application period, to give everyone a fair shot.
   

  

**QUESTIONS?**
 Hanne Lill Johnsen, Marketing Director, is happy to answer questions about daily work, expectations and team setup on 5 feb - between 13-16 (+47 41570095, only for candidates!)
   

  

 For any additional questions about the process, I, Alessia Porazzi, Talent Acquisition Partner, am here for you on LinkedIn or email (alessia.porazzi(at)vend.com).
   

  

**RECRUITMENT PROCESS?**
* First step with Talent Acquisition Partner, Alessia ( your background, skills & growth goals, Vend as an employer)
* Second meeting with Hanne Lill (diving deeper into your background & skills, role goals & expectations)
* Final meeting with the team (case scenario, diving deeper into your team vision and way of thinking)
* Reference check and offer!

title: Senior Customer Services Representative
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly
 **BELIEVE** 
 in what they're doing!
   

  

*We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.*
*If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us* 
*!*

title: Staff iOS Engineer
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards.
