Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 As PayPal continues its mission to revolutionize commerce, we’re looking for a skilled Staff iOS Engineer to join our Wallet Mobile Engineering Organization. In this role, you’ll help shape the next generation of PayPal’s mobile wallet, a multi-year initiative that will reach hundreds of millions of users worldwide. You’ll lead architectural decisions, guide technical strategy, and collaborate with teams across PayPal to deliver secure, scalable, and innovative mobile experiences. If this sounds exciting, read on — the best is yet to come!
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Essential Responsibilities:**
* Acts as a project or system leader, coordinating the activities of other engineers on the project or within the system
* Determines the technical tasks that other engineers will follow
* Actions result in the achievement of customer, operational, program or service objectives
* Proactively improves existing structures & processes
* Exercises judgement in reconciling diverse and competing priorities (time, quality, complexity risk) to identify optimal solutions to problems
* Notices patterns and condenses repetition into densely meaningful generalized solutions
* Collaborates with management to set/improve standards for engineering rigor
* Trusted to represent PayPal, Inc to the outside world via interactions with partners, customers, or industry organizations


**Expected Qualifications:**
* 5+ years relevant experience and a Bachelor’s degree OR Any equivalent combination of education and experience.


**Additional Responsibilities And Preferred Qualifications**
**Meet the Team**
 In this role, you’ll join our
 **NFC Mobile Engineering Team** 
 , a tight-knit group building PayPal’s next-generation contactless payment experiences. The team includes several Europe-based engineers and a Technical Project Manager. We’re expanding in Sweden to boost real-time collaboration, accelerate development and code reviews, and better support NFC testing and rollout across European markets. It’s a great opportunity to work with talented peers and make a meaningful impact on a multi-year product roadmap.
   

  

**Your day-to-day**
 As a Staff iOS Engineer, you’ll get the opportunity to influence the technical direction of our mobile wallet and drive engineering excellence across the team. Day to day, you’ll be involved in:
   

  

* Designing and evolving the iOS architecture that powers PayPal’s mobile wallet
* Building high-quality, scalable iOS features using Swift and Objective-C.
* Partnering with product, design, and downstream engineering teams to define requirements and deliver world-class mobile experiences.
* Mentoring and coaching engineers, fostering a culture of innovation, craftsmanship, and continuous improvement.
* Leading technical discussions, architectural reviews, and contributing to long-term mobile strategy.
* Driving experimentation, innovation, and best practices in mobile development.


**What You Need To Succeed**
* 8+ years of hands-on experience in iOS development.
* Strong expertise in Swift, Objective-C, and iOS architecture.
* Proven experience designing and delivering software platforms or libraries.
* Deep understanding of Cocoa frameworks, Xcode, and mobile development patterns.
* Strong object-oriented design, coding, and testing skills.
* Ability to design scalable, reliable, and maintainable mobile systems.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to lead and influence cross-functional teams.


**Get bonus points with…**
* Experience with mobile payments, financial apps, or secure mobile integrations.
* Proficiency with React Native.
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins), monitoring tools (Crashlytics), and testing frameworks.
* Experience optimizing mobile performance at scale.
* A track record of influencing technical direction or driving mobile architecture.


**We Believe in You!**
 Interested in knowing more? Don't hesitate to apply or/and let's talk – we'd love to get to know you!
   

  

 \_
   

  

 PayPal does not charge candidates any fees for courses, applications, resume reviews, interviews, background checks, or onboarding. Any such request is a red flag and likely part of a scam. To learn more about how to identify and avoid recruitment fraud please visit https://careers.pypl.com/contact-us.
   

  

 For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.
   

  

**Our Benefits:**
 At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset-you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
   

  

 We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com
   

  

**Who We Are:**
 To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx
   

  

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.
   

  

**Belonging at PayPal:**
 Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.
   

  

 Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.
   

  

 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.
   

  

 REQ ID R0132783

title: Revenue Development Specialist
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

**The role**
 We’re looking for a
 **Revenue Development Specialist** 
 to help design, execute, and scale Mentimeter’s revenue strategy and go-to-market planning. Operating at the intersection of strategy, data, and execution, you’ll shape our revenue initiatives, drive planning cycles in close collaboration with leadership, and lead high-impact commercial bets.
   

  

 You are obsessed with big growth opportunities, always on the hunt for new ways to make money and unafraid to take initiative to make it happen. You’ll work closely with Marketing, Sales, and Analytics to evaluate GTM performance, uncover new growth levers, and ensure our strategies turn into measurable results. Reporting to the Director of Revenue Development, you’ll play a key role in ensuring our commercial teams are guided by clear plans, bold goals, and innovative approaches to growth.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Revenue Strategy: Maintain and update frameworks and segmentation models that create clarity and support decision-making across GTM motions.
* Revenue Planning: Support annual and quarterly planning cycles, target setting, and commercial initiative design in collaboration with Analytics and Revenue leaders.
* Revenue Initiatives: Project lead cross-functional projects and strategic bets that require dedicated focus, from evaluating new tools and AI approaches to piloting innovative GTM models.
* Insights & Evaluation: Partner with Analytics to measure GTM performance, evaluate ROI, and provide recommendations that shape our investment decisions.


**What We’re Looking For**
* 2–5 years of experience in strategy, consulting, SaaS operations, or a related field.
* High business acumen and a strong understanding of SaaS or B2B commercial models.
* Analytical and data-driven, comfortable working with numbers and translating insights into recommendations.
* Highly structured with the ability to manage multiple projects and stakeholders simultaneously.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset; able to align diverse stakeholders around shared goals.
* Curiosity and drive to explore new technologies, processes, and ways of working.


**Why this role matters**
 This role is pivotal in making sure Mentimeter’s GTM strategy is not just designed but executed effectively. By combining strategic frameworks with data-driven insights and strong collaboration, you’ll help drive Mentimeter’s growth.
   

  

 📍
 **Location:** 
 This is a hybrid role at Mentimeter HQ in Stockholm.
   

  

 Please note that we do
 *not* 
 offer relocation sponsorship for the position.
   

  

**💡Our Recruitment Process**
* Alva Labs personality & logical tests
* Introduction interview
* Business Case (home assignment)
* Competence interview
* Culture interview
* References & Offer


 At Mentimeter, design is part of every step — from early exploration to shipping and learning. We believe in shared ownership, empowered teams, and space to grow our craft together.
   

  

**Join us in shaping the future of meetings. We'd love to hear from you!**
 At Mentimeter, where we currently boast over 50+ different nationalities, you'll be part of a culture that values creativity, innovation, and inclusivity. We believe in supporting our team members' growth and offering them the platform to excel. If you're eager to contribute to our mission and make a significant impact, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

 Not sure you meet 100% of our requirements?
   

  

 Apply anyway and let us know why you would enjoy working on this particular role at Mentimeter!
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**AI and Hiring at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter, we believe AI helps us work smarter - but it never replaces the human assessment, curiosity, and personal connection that define our culture and our hiring. We use AI as a sparring partner: to bounce ideas, bring new perspectives, support structure, and make our work more efficient. But the meaning, decisions, and interactions always come from people.
   

  

* AI does not screen or decide on candidates.
* There is no automated filtering, ranking, or decision-making in our recruitment process. Every application is reviewed by a person.
* Hiring teams may use AI to support their work - for example, to structure notes, prepare interview questions, or organize their thinking.


 AI strengthens our work, but it does not define it. At Mentimeter, we’re not building an AI-driven hiring process - we’re building a people-first culture, where technology helps us listen, learn, and grow together.
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Elektronikingenjör – systemnivå inom satellitkommunikation
description:
Ovzon arbetar i framkant inom satellitkommunikation och utvecklar markterminaler som används i kritiska miljöer världen över. Rollen som elektronikingenjör är för dig som tycker det är roligt när det är svårt, som älskar teknik och som tidigare kommit i kontakt med elektronikdesign på systemnivå. Om du dessutom sedan barnsben plockat isär varje pryl du kommit över - då är det här arbetsplatsen för dig!
 



  





**OM ROLLEN:** 




 Ovzon utvecklar satellitkommunikationssystem där elektroniken måste vara robust, tillförlitlig och genomtänkt in i minsta detalj. I utvecklingsteamet arbetar ingenjörer med hög teknisk kompetens och stor ambitionsnivå. Här finns många specialister att lära av, samtidigt som du förväntas bidra med egna idéer och driva ditt arbete framåt. Miljön passar dig som vill växa, som brinner för teknik och som har en nyfikenhet som gör dig till en skarp samt ihärdig problemlösare.
 



  





**ARBETSUPPGIFTER:** 




 Som elektronikingenjör hos Ovzon arbetar du i gränslandet mellan utveckling, integration och verifiering av deras markterminaler. Rollen är bred och kräver både systemförståelse och praktisk ingenjörsskicklighet.
 



  





 Du fokuserar på elektronikens funktion som helhet och utformar lösningar för hur bl.a. kretskort, kablage och moduler ska samverka i systemet.
 



  





 Du kommer bland annat att:
 


* Utveckla och förbättra elektroniklösningar i markterminalerna
* Ta ansvar för elektronikkort på systemnivå — interaktion mellan moduler, gränssnitt och kablage
* Utföra verifiering, mätningar och analys av egna konstruktioner
* Skriva enklare testkod och verktyg för att utvärdera funktion och prestanda
* Arbeta i labbmiljö och praktiskt testa, mäta, felsöka och utveckla



  





 Det här är ett jobb för dig som verkligen gillar att ”skruva, mäta och förstå”, samtidigt som du vill arbeta med avancerade system där elektronik, RF och embedded möts.
 



  





**VI SÖKER DIG SOM:** 



* Har en civilingenjörsutbildning inom elektroteknik
* Har ett stort tekniskt intresse och gärna egna hobbyprojekt - det värderar vi högt
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta med elektronikdesign på systemnivå
* Kan kommunicera obehindrat på både svenska och engelska



  





 Personliga egenskaper väger tungt. Du är analytisk, noggrann och nyfiken på varför saker fungerar som de gör. Du samarbetar väl med andra, tar initiativ och trivs i en miljö där alla driver sitt arbete framåt.
 



  





**OM ANSTÄLLNINGEN:** 




 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag vilket innebär att du kommer till en början att vara anställd av Friday. Ambitionen från Ovzon och vår sida är att du efter en tid blir direktanställd hos Ovzon.
 



  





**ÖVRIG INFO:** 




 Omfattning: Tillsvidare
 



 Start: Enligt överrenskommelse
 



 Placering: Solna
 



 Rekryteringsansvarig: Anna Persson
 



 Lön: Marknadsmässig
 



  





 Ansök genom att klicka på länken nedan. Kom ihåg att vara snabb med din ansökan då vi gör löpande urval av kandidater och att annonsen kan stängs ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.
 



  





**OM FRIDAY:** 




*Genom att vara en partner både till våra kandidater och kunder strävar vi efter att hitta den bästa matchningen. Det gör vi genom att lära känna våra kunder och kandidater på riktigt! Vi ser självklart till att kunskaps- och erfarenhetskrav matchar, men framförallt lägger vi vikt vid samsyn kring värderingar och företagskultur som båda parter värdesätter.* 




*Vår passion är att hjälpa människor till rätt roll, arbetsplats och sammanhang inom IT och teknik. Därför grundade vi Friday med ambition att hjälpa dig till jobbet som ger dig fredagskänslan – varje dag!* 




*Vi riktar oss främst till dig som är i början av din karriär eller studerar vid högskola/universitet inom IT och Teknik.* 




*Vår övertygelse är att människor uppnår sin fulla potential när man ser fram emot att gå till jobbet varje morgon. ”Friday – everyday”, hur låter det?*

title: Sales Specialist Mission Critical
description:
Telia Cygate befinner sig i en spännande tillväxt- och förändringsresa! Mitt namn är Fredrik Gidlund och jag arbetar som Affärsområdesansvarig för vårt satsningsområde inom Mission Critical. Vi söker nu en Sales Specialist som vill utveckla våra kunders förmågor inom totalförsvaret kopplat till våra lösningar och tjänster inom Nätverk, Säkerhet och Suveräna datacenterlösningar.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som brinner för och vill arbeta med kunder som tillhör Sveriges totalförsvar samt arbeta i affärsgränssnittet mellan verksamheten och tekniken, där du omsätter kundens utmaningar till värdefulla lösningar!
   

  

****Vad du kommer göra i rollen:****
 Som Sales Specialist inom Mission Critical agerar som rådgivare och
   

  

 förespråkare för vår förflyttning inom IT-infrastruktur kopplat till kunder inom totalförsvaret. Du kommer vara en del i teamet med att utveckla vår taktik och strategi inom våra tre områden Nätverk, Säkerhet & Suveräna datacenterlösningar, med fokus på områdesbevakning, intäktsutveckling och förbättringsaktiviteter.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du att arbeta med komplex produkt och tjänsteförsäljning till kunder inom totalförsvaret. Du kommer att ansvara för ett antal kunders avtal, intäkter och lönsamhet samt bearbeta marknaden för att vinna nya avtal. Rollen innebär att vara en stark lagspelare för att kunna ge kunderna de förmågorna de behöver för att klara av sin uppgift.
   

  

 Vidare kommer du att:
   

  

* Utveckla relation och kunskap om kundernas verksamhet.
* Skapa en tydlig bild av vilka produkter och tjänster kunderna behöver.
* Sälja Mission Critical produkter och tjänster.
* Delta i att utveckla och planera taktik och strategi utefter marknadens behov och efterfrågan av IT-infrastruktur.
* Samarbeta med våra strategiska partners, konsultchefer, konsulter & arkitekter.
* Genomdriva och utveckla kund-workshops samt governanceramverk för att ”guida” våra kunder inom IT-infrastruktur.


**För att lyckas i rollen:**
 Som person är du en skicklig kommunikatör, och är trygg i dialogen med människor på alla nivåer av en organisation. Du använder din omvärldskunskap för att adressera kunders behov. Du är van i att arbeta självständigt med höga mål och mångårig erfarenhet av liknande roller med dokumenterade resultat. Samtidigt är du en lagspelare som gillar ett tillåtande klimat i ditt team. Du har tidigare jobbat taktiskt och operativt med komplex B2B försäljning inom telekom. Du vill vara med och utveckla kundernas förmågor.
   

  

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet komplex B2B försäljning och driva affären från prospekt till avtal.
* God kunskap inom IT-infrastruktur (även inom Telekom och Datakom är meriterande).
* Förmåga inspiratör med målfokus i en föränderlig vardag.
* Flytande engelska i tal o skrift.


**Varför Telia Cygate?**
 På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. Vi gör det alltid med värme, omtanke och ett leende. Här är det idéerna och våra olika perspektiv som gör oss starka, och tillsammans ser vi till att teknikens värld blir en plats där alla trivs – och där du hör hemma.
   

  

 Hos oss är din utveckling viktig. Vi uppmuntrar till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och ser till att just du och dina intressen är i fokus. Vi vet att det är människorna som utgör vårt företag, och därför värdesätter vi glädje, kreativitet och olika perspektiv i allt vi gör.
   

  

 Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss, där vi gör teknik mänsklig och skapar verklig påverkan
 **!**
**Vad vi erbjuder**
 När du börjar hos oss får du ett omfattande förmånspaket anpassat efter din lokala marknad, möjlighet till hybridarbete och mer. Du har också chans att få bonus baserat på din prestation och Telias resultat.
   

  

**Låter det intressant?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan senast
 **2026-02-15.** 
 Rollen kan komma att stängas tidigare om vi hittar rätt kandidat – så vänta inte för länge!
   

  

 Placeringsort: Solna
   

  

 Tjänsten omfattas av en del resor och övernattningar främst inom Sverige och körkort samt svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav. Bakgrundskontroller och Säkerhetsprövningar ingår i rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Om du går vidare i processen kommer du att kontaktas av vår
 **Talent Acquisition Partner** 
 . Bakgrund- och referenskontroller ingår i processen.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om rollen? Kontakta gärna Fredrik Gidlund, på fredrik.gidlund@cygate.se.
   

  

**Lika möjligheter för alla**
 På Telia värderar vi kompetens och utvecklingspotential. Vi främjar mångfald och ser till att varje individs behov tillgodoses, oavsett funktionsvariation, kön, ålder, nationalitet, sexuell läggning eller social bakgrund. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande arbetsmiljö där din unikhet är vår styrka.
   

  

**Välkommen till Telia Cygate – Home of Experts**

title: Life Science Manager North Region
description:
**Job Description**
**Life Science Practice Leader Northern Region**
**Role Purpose**
 The primary purpose of the role is the Leadership of the Northern Region Life Science Industry Practice. It is the ultimate underwriting leader within the region for Life Science. The leader is responsible for Life Science IP across all lines and to lead dedicated and non-dedicated underwriters.
   

  

 The Life Science Lead Northern Region is the Best Practice leader across the region.
   

  

 The successful candidate must demonstrate strong competency and experience in the following areas:
   

  

**Technical Underwriting Skills**
 The Lead will be expected to have strong experience in underwriting of Casualty, E&O, and Clinical Trials as they relate to Life Science companies, and have a broad understanding of Chubb’s appetite, preferred risks and wordings as well as those of key competitors. Ultimately, the role must be capable of holding high levels of underwriting authority and be comfortable taking referral work from the Northern Life Science team.
   

  

 The Lead should also have a good awareness of the underwriting appetite and processes for other target lines of business such as property, cyber, marine etc to drive cross-sell, and be closely connected to those leaders and communities.
   

  

**Planning & Execution**
 Prepare and execute a business plan for the Life Science Industry Practice with key actions and tactics. This should include market sizing / evaluation of the opportunity and product/solution development (build the product, proposition and consider appropriate distribution channels). Delivery and monitoring of the financial plan across all lines of business is a critical responsibility for this role, ensuring that rate, retention and new business numbers are planned and forecast accurately and that monthly production targets are met.
   

  

**Target Operating Models**
 Lead and actively support adherence to Chubb’s target operating models. This will require an understanding of the Operating Model that Chubb wishes to follow and pro-active execution to achieve the required outcome. Working with team members in the Madrid HUB and other stakeholders to ensure renewal business migrates effectively, where applicable. Knowledge and regular use of Chubb’s systems including but not limited to Jarvis, Ignite, PMR, QlikView and Insight therefore as a prerequisite. Drive and maintain best practice and disciplines around usage of key operational systems, such as Workview. Look for opportunities to continuously improve our processes to generate operational efficiency.
   

  

**People Management**
 There are direct and indirect reports to the role in a matrix environment of a team of underwriters across the Northern region. This role will set the vision and plan, support the day to day needs of the team, plus play an active part in supporting the talent and development needs of underwriters. Regular travel is required to cover the various countries in the Northern Region (i.e. Netherlands, Belgium, Sweden, Finland, Denmark and Norway) as well as to Spain (Madrid) where the Hub is located.
   

  

**Broker and market engagement**
 Understand the broker landscape for Life Science across the Northern region and directly support high value relationships and opportunities. Ensure focus around driving the pipeline of new business activity with underwriters and Distribution (both from short- and long-term perspective) to meet plan. Raise Chubb’s profile as a Life Science industry expert across all lines of business through marketing collateral and events, engagement with technical market bodies, plus speaking at client, broker, and industry forums/events.
   

  

 Closely work and engage with Broker management resources, CUO, country managers and segment leaders across both the Nordics and Benelux.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Underwriting Referral – act as the main referral point for underwriters on Life Science business.
* Multiline – Lead a multiline strategy with focus on cross-sell of additional lines to Life Science clients. Work with LoB leaders and champions to create a broader Life Science multiline community focused on working together to deliver multi line propositions for our Life Science clients.
* Delivering Plan – Prepare and execute a business plan for the Life Science Industry Practice with key actions and tactics. Delivering and exceeding the Life Science Industry Practice financial plan.
* Strategic focus - Working closely with Line Managers and the Region to formulate and deliver on an underwriting strategy. Ensuring quality control within defined area of responsibility by undertaking quantitative underwriting reviews, running regular management meetings. Supporting effective management of the portfolio.
* Procedures - Meet company standards in respect of policy documentation, contract certainty and compliance and regulatory requirements.
* Compliance – Closely work with the UoM on Peer review implementation across the practice and the completion of all audit requirements and actions within agreed timescales and adherence to all legal compliance standards.
* Leadership - Promoting Chubb as a ‘Go to’ market to brokers and clients. Acting as a senior representative for the Life Science Industry Practice (both internally and externally) for all lines of business, driving the strategic relationships, in terms of trading and execution with all our broking partners. Supporting and encouraging colleagues to drive the business. Responsible for the strategic and operational management of the team.
* Product Development - Developing and seeking out new opportunities to innovate within the Life Science Industry practice, working with other stakeholders (including other Product lines) to generate new ideas. Regularly conduct and share market research and intelligence. Identify and harness new opportunities.
* Training/People - Working with regional managers to ensure the provision of appropriate training and mentoring support in the team to support appropriate authority delegation. Support a robust succession planning is in place across the practice.
* Operational Management - Understanding, interpreting, and communicating to the team effectively the Strategic Priorities of the Practice. Continually monitoring and effectively managing the allocation of resource to meet business objectives, partly through input to People Mangers, ensuring external priorities and broker needs are constantly at the forefront of our decision-making process. Shaping and refreshing roles for employees, maximising both individual employees’ and the team’s potential. Manage, track and review performance of the team and individual team members.


**Qualifications**
**Skills & Experience required:**
* Previous underwriting experience is essential
* Extensive knowledge of the Life Science sector & Life Science underwriting is preferable
* Strong working knowledge of the insurance market and competitors
* Portfolio management capabilities are essential
* People management and motivation skills are preferable
* Results driven with ability to make own decisions and work on own initiative
* An experienced professional whose expertise is recognized externally
* Being able to demonstrate examples of strategy development and operational improvement would be desirable
* Ability to execute and influence at all levels both internally and externally
* Ability to cover a larger region and openness to work across various countries and insurance markets.

title: Projektledare inom fastighetsinstallationer i sjukhusmiljö
description:
I sjukhusfastigheter är tekniken en förutsättning för människors liv och hälsa – varje installation, varje ombyggnation och varje beslut. I rollen som projektledare får du chansen att arbeta med tekniska projekt i driften av ett av världens mest avancerade sjukhus. I rollen får du kombinera teknik, arbetsberedning och samordning – i en miljö där ditt arbete faktiskt spelar roll på riktigt.
 



  





**OM TJÄNSTEN:** 




 Vi söker nu en projektledare inom fastighetsinstallationer till Coor. I rollen arbetar du nära den dagliga driften och ansvarar för att ombyggnationer och tekniska installationer genomförs med hög kvalitet, struktur och säkerhet.
 



  





 Du blir en del av ett prestigefyllt och samhällsviktigt uppdrag: att säkerställa den tekniska driften på Nya Karolinska Solna. Rollen passar dig som fortfarande är tidigt i karriären men redo att ta ansvar, utvecklas och växa in i en projektledande roll i en komplex fastighetsmiljö.
 



  





**ARBETSUPPGIFTER:** 




 I rollen driver och koordinerar du projekt inom fastighetsinstallationer – från demontering och ombyggnation till färdigställande och överlämning till drift. Projekten varierar i omfattning och kräver både struktur, samarbete och förståelse för tekniska samband.
 



  





 Sjukhusmiljön innebär särskilda krav och utmaningar, vilket gör att du snabbt bygger värdefull erfarenhet. Du har många kontaktytor och samarbetar med driftpersonal, entreprenörer, specialister och beställare. Rollen ger dig möjlighet att röra dig mellan olika fastigheter och forum där din tekniska förståelse och samordningsförmåga kommer till sin rätt.
 



  





**VI SÖKER DIG SOM:** 



* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område, alternativt motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Arbetslivserfarenhet från en samordnande roll
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska, både i tal och skrift



  





 Meriterande:
 


* Förståelse för drift och installationer i fastigheter
* Erfarenhet av arbete i sjukhusmiljö, Facility Management eller byggentreprenader.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av projektledning



  





 Du är strukturerad, noggrann och trivs med att ha koll på detaljer – samtidigt som du ser helheten. Du gillar att lösa problem, ta ansvar och samarbeta med många olika personer. Du anpassar din kommunikation efter situation och mottagare, och du är nyfiken på att utvecklas i din yrkesroll.
 



  





 Här får du möjlighet att växa in i en viktig roll, i en tekniskt avancerad miljö där ditt arbete gör skillnad – varje dag.
 



  





**ÖVRIG INFO:** 



* Omfattning: Heltid
* Start: Så snart som möjligt med hänsyn till ev uppsägningstid
* Placering: Stockholm
* Rekryteringsansvarig: Anna Persson
* Lön: Marknadsmässig



  





 Ansök genom att klicka på länken nedan. Kom ihåg att vara snabb med din ansökan då vi gör löpande urval av kandidater och att annonsen kan stängs ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.
 



  





**OM ANSTÄLLNINGEN:** 




 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag vilket innebär att du kommer till en början att vara anställd av Friday. Ambitionen från Kunden och vår sida är att du efter en tid blir direktanställd hos kunden.
 



  





**OM FRIDAY:** 




*Genom att vara en partner både till våra kandidater och kunder strävar vi efter att hitta den bästa matchningen. Det gör vi genom att lära känna våra kunder och kandidater på riktigt! Vi ser självklart till att kunskaps- och erfarenhetskrav matchar, men framförallt lägger vi vikt vid samsyn kring värderingar och företagskultur som båda parter värdesätter.* 




*Vår passion är att hjälpa människor till rätt roll, arbetsplats och sammanhang inom IT och teknik. Därför grundade vi Friday med ambition att hjälpa dig till jobbet som ger dig fredagskänslan – varje dag!* 




*Vi riktar oss främst till dig som är i början av din karriär eller studerar vid högskola/universitet inom IT och Teknik.* 




*Vår övertygelse är att människor uppnår sin fulla potential när man ser fram emot att gå till jobbet varje morgon. ”Friday – everyday”, hur låter det?* 




*Sökord: projektledare, facility management, fastighetsdrift, fastighetsinstallationer, VVS, installationer, entreprenad, styr- och reglerteknik, fastighetsautomation, installationssamordnare, fastighet, fastighetsteknik, drifttekniker, driftledare.*

title: Fibre, Colocation & Wavelength Product Manager
description:
**Job Description**
 We are Arelion. Even if you have not heard of us; we are pretty sure you are using our network every day! As one of the largest Tier 1 Network providers, operating the most connected Internet backbone on the planet, we are quite passionate about what we do. The one thing we have in common is our passion for the Internet, our belief that a connected world is a brighter world, and our dedication to our honored customers. With a history of more than 30 years in building the Global Internet, we became a standalone company in 2021. We are now on a transformation journey to write the next chapter in our book.
   

  

 We are currently looking for a Product Manager on a short-term 3-to-6-month contract, 50% to 75% basis minimum subject to agreement, to oversee our Wavelength, Fibre and Colocation product portfolio.  
   

 Our Product Management team supports the entire organization, shaping and defining our products and services to delight our customers. By working closely with stakeholders across the company, the team ensures commercial success across our routes-to-market, and capabilities for operational support in line with high-quality customer experience. 
   

  

 Your role will be very closely linked to network expansion planning and managing newest technologies. You will be working closely with sales to enable sustainable growth through new customer acquisitions, enhancing product features and delivering on the best customer experience.
   

  

 There could not be a more exciting time for high-capacity services at Arelion, with AI investments fueling fibre market and fibre sales in turn driving investments in network expansion.
   

* We have a significant fibre and duct network in Europe, including “hot spot” regions like the Nordics
* We continuously invest in our network reach and network upgrades to improve customer experience related to latency, available capacity and availability – check the New PoPs site where we list all new PoP announcements.
* We are always ahead of industry trends, and we always trial the newest technologies to stay ahead of competition and provide our customers with the best experience. Ciena world’s first live 1.6 Tb/s Wave data transmission is just one example.


 Sharing a start-up mindset, we are a flat organization that works together to achieve great things, following our values Empower, Excite and Excel. As product manager, this means that you will be asked to put customers first, peeking beyond silos and teams to sometimes act across our entire portfolio, supporting digitalization and automation initiatives. 
   

  

**Job Requirements**
**Skills & Requirements**
**We believe that you have:** 
* Strong expertise in Fibre and Wavelength connectivity solutions as well as understanding of the use cases that they enable. You also need a good understanding of business dynamics and markets – especially evolving Fibre market
* Demonstrable experience supporting projects across a number of teams in a constantly changing environment; ability to engage and drive product development activities cross-functional and cross-cultural teams and manage the day-to-day operations around it.
* Ability to drive results in an international high pace environment, understanding cultural differences, and collaborating seamlessly whether on site or remote; a good level of expertise in translating and driving proposition ideas into commercial success, along with strong communication skills to translate multiple projects into a single clear Product view
* A data-driven mindset, analytical skills and strong business orientation
* Excellent people skills, with a positive and collaborative approach and experience developing strong networks across multiple internal stakeholder and delivery areas
* Resilient and able to adjust to changing objectives and communicate these positively to others


**Your personal characteristics**
 You have a strong will to contribute, are passionate about Product Management, and believe that global connectivity can be made better and simpler with less friction. You are eager to learn new things and at the same time open to sharing knowledge and experience with your colleagues. Furthermore, you are open to working in a mix of methodologies, nationalities, and cultures.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
**Key responsibilities include**
* Act as the knowledge leader, internal and external, for our core products Wavelengths, Fibre and Colocation – you are able and willing to drive the overall execution of the product roadmap aligned with own network developments
* Support creation and execution of network expansion business cases, assess impacts and act as the subject matter expert
* Take product and business ownership of key developments, defining clear business vision and working with technology and operational teams to deliver planned and new improvements for the Wavelength, Fibre and Colocation portfolios
* Work with the marketing teams to develop and launch customer-facing messaging for use in marketing channels or in PR, along with internal knowledge bases in all channels including web, intranet, operational FAQ etc.
* Work with the legal team to develop relevant T&Cs and work on marketing claims substantiation where necessary, support product evaluation of 3rd party legal agreements and customer specific requests
* You will be the “lender of last resort” in your knowledge area – the fixer of unfixed problems that no one else knows what to do with it.


**Job Benefits**
 It's an exciting time for high-capacity services at Arelion - you will be working on global backbone with AI investments fueling fibre market!

title: Territory Manager
description:
Veeam, the #1 global market leader in data resilience, believes businesses should control all their data whenever and wherever they need it. Veeam provides data resilience through data backup, data recovery, data portability, data security, and data intelligence. Based in Seattle, Veeam protects over 550,000 customers worldwide who trust Veeam to keep their businesses running. Join us as we move forward together, growing, learning, and making a real impact for some of the world’s biggest brands. The future of data resilience is here - go fearlessly forward with us.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Territory Manager will be responsible for developing/closing business indirectly with a number of customers in their assigned market territory through working with the partner sales community. The primary focus is aimed at closing sales opportunities and is achieved by collaborating with partners to identify, develop, accelerate, up-sell and close transactions.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Develop and close business with accounts
* Leverage partners to close sales with their end customers
* Cold calls to develop sales activities with a large number of new mid-market and high-segment end users
* Up-sell and cross-sell to the existing customer base
* Forecasts and account/opportunity details in SalesForce
* Propose, coordinate and participate to marketing activities in the defined territory


**What You’ll Bring**
* Fluent in English
* Direct, new business sales experience
* Experience with vendors associated with Virtualization technology is a plus
* Have experience of selling through channel and direct
* Track record of accomplishment selling to the IT infrastructure specialists
* Proven ability to develop new sales
* Be a self-starter with the ability to learn quickly
* Be a high-energy salesperson
* Be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment where roles and responsibilities change quickly
* Be comfortable travelling for at least 50% of the time.
* Current full driving license


**What You'll Get**
* 30 paid vacation days, plus 4 extra global VeeaMe Days for self-care and 24 paid volunteer hours annually through Veeam Cares
* Private health insurance with priority access to treatment
* Life insurance with enhanced coverage and child benefit
* Disability insurance after 90 days of illness
* Accident insurance covering work and commute
* Supplemental pension with employer contribution
* Opportunities to learn and grow through on-demand libraries (LinkedIn Learning, O’Reilly), mentoring, workshops and learning events like our annual Global Day of Learning


 Please note: If the applicant is permanently located outside of Sweden. Veeam reserves the right to decline the application for the position. Remote work is only possible for employees located in Finland.
   

  

**Veeam Software is an equal opportunity employer** 
 and does not tolerate discrimination in any form on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law. All your information will be kept confidential.
   

  

 Please note that any personal data collected from you during the recruitment process will be processed in accordance with our Recruiting Privacy Notice.
   

  

 The Privacy Notice sets out the basis on which the personal data collected from you, or that you provide to us, will be processed by us in connection with our recruitment processes.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you consent to the processing of your personal data in accordance with our Recruiting Privacy Notice.
   

  

**By submitting your application, you acknowledge that the information provided in your job application and any supporting documents is complete and accurate to the best of your knowledge. Any misrepresentation, omission, or falsification of information may result in disqualification from consideration for employment or, if discovered after employment begins, termination of employment.**

title: Head of Mobility and Classic Solutions Architecture
description:
**Why you should join our team**
 Are you passionate about leading architects that enable business growth in a dynamic, agile environment? If so, join Mobility and Classic Solutions, where we develop and maintain cutting-edge solutions for branded motor insurance partnerships. From branded web shops and mobile apps to API products and core insurance systems, we cover the entire customer journey and ensure the stability and scalability of our platforms.
   

  

 We are looking for a new colleague to be our new
 **Head of Mobility and Classic Solutions architecture** 
 unit.
   

  

**About This Role**
 In this position you will lead the unit’s architectural function which entails further shaping and securing the architectural direction, securing that we have a good collaborative environment with our stakeholders, and to secure that the team has the right competencies over time. You will help the area to align with strategies, shape the architecture direction and supporting them in reaching their goal by making the complex simple and efficiently adapting the message to different stakeholders needs.
   

  

**Architect @ If**
 The architect can see and understand things in a larger context. The architect understands the business strategy and the needs of our stakeholders and how that transcends into concrete solutions. One of its most appreciated abilities is to make thoughtful decisions, weighing the pros and cons, making the complex simpler. This leadership position is part of the IT Architecture unit in If. We make sure that we set common direction and have the building blocks in place to underpin business needs and strategies, in deep collaboration with cross-functional product and development teams.
   

  

**About The Team**
 The team currently consists of employees and consultants, two lead architects and 7 solution architects. The architects are located in Stockholm and Riga. The unit is part of the IT Architecture organization. Together, we ensure that architectural decisions are deeply aligned with both business needs and technical feasibility, fostering innovation and quality throughout the company.
   

  

**As Head of Mobility and Classic Solutions Architecture you will**
* Be part of If’s central architecture unit and report to Head of If Architecture Hub.
* Manage and partaking in key architectural deliveries and support the lead architects in driving the direction in your unit.
* Contribute to key strategic initiatives across If as needed.
* Recruit, coach, develop, and support highly skilled and motivated employees within the unit.
* Ensure we have the right relationships, interfaces and good collaboration with the stake holders.
* Secure that Mobility and Classic Solutions needs are discussed when affecting changes outside of the area are planned.
* Participate in relevant needed IT technical governance forums representing Mobility and Classic Solutions and relevant management teams.
* Support business and IT stakeholders in architecture related matters.
* Actively partake in the dialogue with the engineering managers in the area in order to support the overall IT delivery.
* Continuously develop your competencies and build your knowledge about architecture, technology and leadership.
* Collaborate with senior leadership to align enterprise solutions with overall business objectives securing their economic feasibility.
* Lead with a focus on delivering technology transformations with modern, cloud-based architecture, ensuring we take steps in the intended direction and clean up on the way.


**Our promise to you**
* You will drive and be part of highly valued, fun and challenging projects that will move If even further forward.
* You will have as much freedom as possible to accomplish your work – and the accountability that comes with it, but lots of support and great coworkers to help out.
* You will be part of a management team where we naturally share knowledge and know-how among each other on a regular basis and help each other succeed and grow.


**We believe that you**
* Are a curious team player with excellent communication and collaboration skills which you use in order to secure a common direction in the form of anchored roadmaps and execution of them.
* Have a big interest for the Insurance motor business and want to learn more.
* Have experience working with and driving architecture including leading other architects and following-up their deliveries whilst also yourself taking on solution architecture tasks in addition to working on the bigger picture.
* Might previously have worked as a developer where you built a strong technical experience that you have upkept. Furthermore, you have good knowledge in primarily Microsoft technologies and have experience of public cloud solutions like Azure, AWS and Google Cloud.
* Have experience as an architect with development of distributed systems in a complex enterprise setting.
* Have previously held a manager position with personnel responsibility.
* Thrill to work in a fast-paced environment where you make use of your experience to have a strategic mindset also while supporting the operative work.
* Have the ability to relate and make informed architectural decisions and recommendations to business needs and thrive when working in the intersection between business and IT development.


**When asking our colleagues why they choose to work here, they responded …**
* “The possibility to develop myself and learn new things and interesting technical environment”
* “Great colleagues and flexibility”
* “Good team spirit”
* “Good work environment”
* “Life balance – working with quality not quantity”
* “Big investment in IT”
* “Good leadership”
* “Nordic and future oriented company”


**Additional Facts And Recruitment Process**
**Application deadline:** 
 Deadline to apply is 31st of January.
   

**Work location:** 
 Stockholm, Bergshamra
   

**To apply for the position:** 
 Please attach both your CV and answer the questions in the application form.
   

**Travelling:** 
 The team is distributed across several offices so occasional travel is part of the role.
   

  

**Start:** 
 As soon as possible/by agreement.
   

  

 For more information regarding the position, please contact Tomas Sylverberg, e-mail: tomas.sylverberg@if.se
   

  

 Headhunting and consultancy firms are humbly prompted not to respond to this job ad!

title: Senior Backend Engineer [node.js]
description:
**Job Description**
 We're looking for a pragmatic developer who sees code as a tool for solving problems, not an end in itself. You'll build new services in Node.js while working within our existing .NET microservices ecosystem. Your .NET experience helps you understand what we have and your Node.js expertise drives where we're going.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 You'll tackle real business problems, the kind where the solution isn't immediately obvious and requires you to understand context, ask the right questions, and propose approaches that balance trade-offs. You won't be implementing specs handed down from above, you'll be shaping what we build and how we build it, always looking at the product from a customer/user centric view.
   

  

 Our current API landscape is .NET-based microservices with established patterns and conventions rooted in differing design principles. We value pragmatic simplicity over complex cleverness. You'll need to understand this existing architecture while building new services in Node.js that integrate seamlessly with what's already there.
   

  

**The AI Aspect**
 This is non-negotiable, you need to be actively exploring where AI can eliminate tedious work. We expect you to experiment with AI tools, identify opportunities to automate repetitive tasks, and push the boundaries of what you can delegate. If you're not regularly discovering new ways to make AI do the boring parts, you're not the right fit.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**What We're Looking For**
* 4-7 years of software development experience: with strong foundations in both Node.js and .NET.
* .NET proficiency: you can read, understand, and work with our existing C# microservices.
* Node.js expertise: this is your primary strength and what you'll use for new development.
* Microservices experience: you understand service boundaries, inter-service communication, and the trade-offs of distributed systems
* Problem decomposition skills: you can break down ambiguous requirements into concrete, testable solutions
* Customer/user centric view: Building systems from a customer and user centric viewpoint, always asking how this will be perceived by the end user.
* API design experience: you understand REST principles, and don’t try to reinvent the wheel.
* Active AI experimentation: you're already using AI assistants in your workflow and constantly looking for new applications
* Communication clarity: you can explain technical decisions to both developers and non-technical stakeholders.
* Onboarding mindset: you write code and documentation that helps future team members understand


**Technical Environment**
* New development: Node.js/TypeScript
* Existing services: .NET (C#) microservices
* Microservices architecture with established patterns
* Frontend: React/Next.js and Angular
* Standard tooling—we don't chase novelty for its own sake


**Strong Plus If You Have**
* React and Next.js experience: you can work across the full stack when needed
* Angular experience: you understand our existing frontend landscape and can bridge old and new


**What Makes Someone Excel Here**
 You get excited about making things simpler, not more complex. You'd rather delete code than add it. You see patterns across problems and create reusable solutions. You're comfortable saying "I don't know" and then figuring it out in collaboration with others. You view AI as a genuine collaborator in your work, not just a fancy autocomplete. You can bridge the .NET and Node.js worlds, ensuring new services feel like natural extensions of our existing platform.
   

  

**About Us**
**Our People, Our Culture**
 For more than 50 years, Verisk has helped property and casualty insurers make smarter decisions about risk through AI-powered risk modeling, advanced analytics, and technology solutions spanning the entire policy lifecycle. We are a leading strategic data, analytics, and technology partner to the global insurance industry, guided by core values of learning, caring, and results while maintaining the highest ethical standards as stewards of the industry's most comprehensive datasets. Learn more about Verisk and what we are doing within the insurance industry.
   

  

 When you join Verisk, you become part of a diverse global team with over 7,500 professionals in 30 plus countries, making work that matters. We're certified by Great Place to Work, reflecting our commitment to inclusivity, employee engagement, and wellbeing. At Verisk, your growth is a priority—from professional development and tuition benefits to a supportive, flexible workplace culture, we support your continued growth.
   

  

**Our Culture** 
 : Explore our inclusive, people-first culture that fosters innovation, collaboration, and belonging.
   

  

**Awards & Recognition** 
 : See why Verisk is consistently recognized as a Great Place to Work™ around the world.
   

  

**Our Businesses** 
 : Learn about the diverse industries we serve — from insurance and energy to financial services and beyond.
   

  

**Life at Verisk** 
 : Discover what it’s like to work at Verisk through employee stories, team highlights, and culture moments.
   

  

**Careers at Verisk** 
 : Join a global team of problem-solvers and innovators doing meaningful work that’s shaping the future of industries. Whether you're just starting out or looking to take your career to the next level, Verisk offers growth, purpose, and a people-first culture
   

  

 Let’s build something meaningful together!
   

  

 Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.
   

  

 All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. Verisk’s minimum hiring age is 18 except in countries with a higher age limit subject to applicable law.
   

  

 At Verisk, we provide a competitive compensation package aligned with market benchmarks and individual experience, disclosed transparently in accordance with applicable pay transparency regulations. In addition to base salary, eligible roles may include a range of incentive opportunities designed based on market research and our internal grading structure.
   

  

 Our benefits portfolio varies by location; however, a typical package includes medical coverage, life insurance, pension plans, and paid time off in line with local labor laws.
   

  

 We also foster a work environment focused on well-being and career development. Additional perks may include wellness initiatives, fitness programs, and team-building activities.
   

  

 https://www.verisk.com/company/careers/
   

  

 Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine, or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.
   

  

 Verisk Employee Privacy Notice

title: Expert in AI driven Search
description:
**About Curamando**
 Curamando, part of the consulting house Eidra, is a leading digital growth consultancy, combining deep expertise in strategy, marketing and technology to help ambitious companies accelerate their digital and AI transformation. Our teams work at the intersection of business and digital, partnering with clients like Polestar, Volvo and Samsung, to drive measurable results across Paid Media, SEO, Insights & Analytics, AI and Business Consulting. Join Curamando and be part of a dynamic environment where you’ll collaborate with top talent, solve complex challenges, and shape the future of digital business.
   

  

**Your role as Expert in AI driven search**
 As an Expert in AI driven search at Curamando, you combine deep hands‑on SEO expertise with growth strategy and advisory. You work with organic traffic and visibility as a core growth driver for our clients — not only in traditional search engines, but also in AI‑powered search experiences.
   

  

 In this role, you are responsible for both execution and advisory. You translate data, insights, and market changes into concrete actions and measurable business impact. You work closely with clients and senior colleagues to plan, execute, and optimize SEO and GEO initiatives, while also advising on growth strategy, channel mix, and investment priorities.
   

  

 You have a strong understanding of technical, on‑page, and off‑page SEO, and how SEO, UX, and content together drive conversion and long‑term value. You also stay ahead of how search is evolving — from classic rankings to AI Overviews, AI‑generated answers, and zero‑click behavior — and help clients adapt their strategies accordingly.
   

  

**What will you do?**
* Drive and develop SEO and GEO strategies in close collaboration with clients and senior consultants.
* Translate SEO, GEO, and growth strategies into clear roadmaps, prioritized actions, and measurable KPIs.
* Analyze data from SEO tools, analytics platforms, and CRM systems to turn insights into practical recommendations and growth plans.
* Execute SEO initiatives across technical SEO, content and on‑page optimization, off‑page strategies, and experimentation.
* Work hands‑on where it adds value, including keyword research, content analysis, and technical SEO audits to support prioritization and results.
* Assess the impact of AI‑driven search developments (e.g. AI Overviews, generative answers, zero‑click journeys) and translate them into forward‑looking GEO strategies and concrete actions.
* Help clients understand when clicks matter and when visibility in AI‑generated answers is the goal, and how this affects the full search funnel.
* Collaborate closely with analysts, UX/UI specialists, paid media consultants, developers, product owners, and business consultants to ensure SEO and GEO are fully integrated into holistic growth strategies.
* Present analyses, insights, and recommendations to client stakeholders, including management, often together with senior colleagues.
* Identify commercial and growth opportunities and support senior colleagues in business development and client growth.


**What do you bring?**
* A completed university degree or YH education, preferably in digital business, marketing, economics, data science, or a related field.
* At least 2 years of relevant experience (e.g. SEO consultant, digital marketing consultant, growth strategist).
* Strong hands‑on experience in organic search and content‑driven growth, with a good understanding of paid media (SEM, SoMe) and CRO.
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to turn data into actions, using tools such as Search Console, Ahrefs, SEMrush, Screaming Frog, GA4, Looker Studio, Tableau, peecAI, AlsoAsked, or similar.
* A strong interest in AI and generative search, and preferably experience with AI tools that are reshaping SEO and digital marketing.
* A proactive, curious, and entrepreneurial mindset, and enjoyment of working in cross‑functional teams.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.


**What do we offer?**
* Most of our work is carried out on-site with our clients, where we are present four days a week. On Fridays, we come together at our vibrant Stockholm headquarters for collaboration, knowledge sharing, and regular social and after-work activities.
* Work with leading brands and ambitious clients in various industries such as automotive, retail, finance, travel and non-profit.
* An entrepreneurial and inspiring work environment with plenty of room for your own initiative.
* Significant opportunities for personal and professional development, with coaching and mentoring as core elements, supported by training and courses across the Eidra group.
* The chance to work for global clients and collaborate with colleagues across our offices in the Nordics, US, Netherlands, UK and Germany.


 Curamando offers tailored consulting services with the best people and assets to help clients build competitive digital marketing and sales capabilities to reach their business goals.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: SAP Retail Architect
description:
Are you ready for the next step in your SAP career? Do you want to work in a flexible environment with exciting assignments. We are now looking for a SAP Retail Architect who wants to help shape the solutions of the future. Welcome to CGI!
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

 The SAP Retail Consultant would be responsible for implementing and supporting SAP Retail solutions, enabling retail businesses to optimize merchandising, sales, and supply chain operations. You would act as a bridge between business stakeholders and the technical team, ensuring SAP solutions meet the functional requirements of retail processes.
   

  

 You will also:
   

  

* Design and develop SAP retail solutions for our retail clients.
* Participating in pre-studies, requirements analysis, and solution design together with clients and project teams.
* Providing advisory services and acting as an expert in SAP for both projects and application management.
* Driving process improvements and innovation using SAP’s latest technologies.


 Our clients are at different stages of their S/4HANA journey – from planning to full implementation – and you will play a central role in guiding them through this transformation.
   

  

**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
* 5+ years of SAP Retail implementation or support experience.
* Experience conducting workshops with business teams to gather requirements and map business processes to SAP best practices.
* Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
* Strong communication skills and experience working in complex project environments and fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.
* Experience with integrations, cloud solutions, and SAP BTP is a plus.


 Strong understanding of retail processes including:
   

  

* Merchandise Management (MM, IS-Retail)
* Assortment and Assortment Planning
* Pricing and Promotions Management
* Store Operations (POS integration, Inventory Management)
* Forecasting, Replenishment, and Supply Chain
* Reporting and Analytics (BW/Embedded Analytics)


 You are great at building strong relationships and quickly understanding new situations. You enjoy working with others, are attentive and supportive, and like to challenge yourself. With both an analytical mindset and creative problem-solving skills, you handle complex tasks with precision and confidence.
   

  

**Want to Learn More?**
 We look forward to hearing from you! Applications will be reviewed continuously, and the position may be filled before the final application deadline. For further questions. please feel free to send your inquiries to Santosh Nimbhorkar, santosh.nimbhorkar@cgi.com
   

  

**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

title: Progress 4 GL utvecklare
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vi söker erfarna Progress-utvecklare till Financial Services i Stockholm. Hos oss på CGI får du arbeta med spännande uppdrag inom försäkring och finans, där teknik, affärsnytta och personlig utveckling går hand i hand.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som Progress Developer blir du en viktig del av vårt team och får arbeta med hela utvecklingsprocessen – från krav och design till utveckling, test och förvaltning. Du kommer både att vidareutveckla befintliga lösningar och bidra till nyutveckling, framför allt inom vårt försäkringsverktyg WinSure.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Gedigen erfarenhet av Progress OpenEdge 4GLoch Progress RDBMS
* Goda kunskaper i GIT
* Erfarenhet av Azure DevOps
* Erfarenhet av försäkringssystem, gärna WinSure
* Minst 10 års erfarenhet som systemutvecklare inom finans/insurance är meriterande


 Som person är du nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och trivs i konsultrollen. Du är trygg i din kompetens men vill ständigt utvecklas – både själv och tillsammans med kollegor och kunder.
   

  

**Varför CGI?**
 Vi erbjuder en kultur som bygger på samarbete, kunskapsdelning och balans i livet. Hos oss får du:
   

  

* Arbeta i inspirerande uppdrag tillsammans med kunniga kollegor
* Tillgång till program för karriär- och kompetensutveckling
* Möjlighet att påverka och växa i en stark global organisation


 Det finns möjlighet till hybridarbete, vilket innebär en flexibel kombination av arbete på kontoret och på distans. Det är en fördel om du är baserad i Stockholm, men vi välkomnar även ansökningar från andra delar av landet!
   

  

 Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens lösningar inom försäkring? Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att höra av dig till rekryterande chef Susann Edvardsson Alpsten på susann.edvardsson@cgi.com
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: National Key Account Manager – Finland & Norway
description:
**This job is with Diageo, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.**
**Job Description**
**National Key Account Manager - Finland & Norway**
**Location:** 
 Sweden
   

  

**Reporting to** 
 : Head of Distribution Markets (Sweden, Norway, Finland & Luxembourg)
   

  

**About Diageo**
 Diageo is the world's leading premium drinks business, with iconic brands including Smirnoff, Captain Morgan, Baileys, Tanqueray, Talisker and Johnnie Walker. Celebrating life every day, everywhere is our purpose, underpinned by our values: Passionate about customers and consumers, Freedom to succeed, Proud of what we do, Be the best, and Valuing each other.
   

  

**Context**
 BxN is a standalone market within the Central and Eastern Europe cluster, comprising Denmark, Sweden, Norway, Finland, Belgium, Netherlands and Luxembourg. The cluster operates across highly diverse routes to market, including monopolies, distributors, and competitive open trade environments, creating a complex and dynamic commercial landscape.
   

  

 In this role, you will be responsible for leading Diageo's distributor-led business in Norway and Finland.
   

  

**Purpose of the Role**
 To lead the commercial agenda across Finland and Norway through distributor partnerships, delivering sustainable growth and long-term value in highly regulated and monopoly-driven environments.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 Strategic Distributor Leadership
   

  

* Own the end-to-end commercial relationship with distributors in Finland and Norway, acting as Diageo's strategic commercial lead.
* Set clear direction, priorities, and expectations through joint business plans, leading through influence and governance rather than day-to-day execution.


 Growth Strategy & Market Development
   

  

* Develop and own the mid- to long-term growth strategy for both markets within monopoly and regulated frameworks.
* Identify portfolio, channel, and route-to-market opportunities to drive sustainable value creation.


 Performance, critical metrics & Governance
   

  

* Define, agree, and rigorously track clear indicators across volume, value, execution, and brand performance.
* Lead structured performance reviews with distributors, ensuring accountability, corrective action, and forecasting accuracy.


 Contract & Commercial Management
   

  

* Lead distributor contract negotiations, renewals, and ongoing commercial governance.
* Ensure commercial terms and ways of working support long-term growth and mutual value creation.


 Monopoly Interface (via Distributors)
   

  

* Provide strategic direction on distributor engagement with Vinmonopolet (Norway) and Alko (Finland), including tender and assortment priorities.
* Challenge distributors to continuously improve the quality of submissions and execution within regulatory constraints.


 Internal Leadership
   

  

* Act as the single commercial owner for Finland and Norway internally, ensuring strong cross-functional alignment and fully compliant execution.


**Ways of Working / Role Expectations**
 This role requires a high level of independence, ownership, and commercial judgement.
   

  

 Success depends on the ability to challenge distributors constructively, set clear expectations, and hold partners accountable for delivery.
   

  

 The role operates with limited day-to-day structure and requires comfort working in ambiguous, regulated environments.
   

  

 This is a leadership role getting results through others but can at time require hands-on executions.
   

  

**Qualifications And Experience Required**
* Strong and broad track record in commercial management, including customer-facing roles with full P&L accountability.
* Proven experience leading commercial strategy and execution in regulated markets and/or with state-owned customers.
* Demonstrated experience managing distributor relationships, setting goals, and navigating cross-cultural collaboration.
* Strong partner management skills with a track record of building credibility and trust.
* Advanced negotiation and influencing capabilities grounded in insight and long-term value creation.
* Strong financial competence and forecasting rigor.
* Fluency in English and at least one Scandinavian language is required.


 Celebrating our inclusive and diverse culture is core to Diageo's purpose of "celebrating life every day everywhere". This purpose is, in itself, inclusive in nature, as it values everybody irrespective of background, disability, religion, gender identity, sexuality or ethnicity.
   

  

 We know that for our business to thrive and for Diageo to realize its ambition, we depend on having diverse talent with a range of backgrounds, skills and capabilities in each of the 180 countries in which we operate and to reflect our broad consumer base. We view diversity as one of the key enablers that helps our business to grow and our values, purpose and standards set the conditions for us to respect the unique contribution each person brings.
   

  

 Flexibility is key to success in our business and many of our staff work flexibly in many different ways, including part-time, compressed hours, flexible location. Please talk to us about what flexibility means to you and don't let anything stop you from applying.
   

  

**Worker Type**
 Regular
   

  

**Primary Location:**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Additional Locations :**
